Line number Line Number of hits Tests that cover line
1 //===-------------- PPCMIPeephole.cpp - MI Peephole Cleanups -------------===// ----
2 // ----
3 // Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions. ----
4 // See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information. ----
5 // SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception ----
6 // ----
7 //===---------------------------------------------------------------------===// ----
8 // ----
9 // This pass performs peephole optimizations to clean up ugly code ----
10 // sequences at the MachineInstruction layer. It runs at the end of ----
11 // the SSA phases, following VSX swap removal. A pass of dead code ----
12 // elimination follows this one for quick clean-up of any dead ----
13 // instructions introduced here. Although we could do this as callbacks ----
14 // from the generic peephole pass, this would have a couple of bad ----
15 // effects: it might remove optimization opportunities for VSX swap ----
16 // removal, and it would miss cleanups made possible following VSX ----
17 // swap removal. ----
18 // ----
19 //===---------------------------------------------------------------------===// ----
20 ----
21 #include "MCTargetDesc/PPCMCTargetDesc.h" ----
22 #include "MCTargetDesc/PPCPredicates.h" ----
23 #include "PPC.h" ----
24 #include "PPCInstrBuilder.h" ----
25 #include "PPCInstrInfo.h" ----
26 #include "PPCMachineFunctionInfo.h" ----
27 #include "PPCTargetMachine.h" ----
28 #include "llvm/ADT/Statistic.h" ----
29 #include "llvm/CodeGen/MachineBlockFrequencyInfo.h" ----
30 #include "llvm/CodeGen/MachineDominators.h" ----
31 #include "llvm/CodeGen/MachineFrameInfo.h" ----
32 #include "llvm/CodeGen/MachineFunctionPass.h" ----
33 #include "llvm/CodeGen/MachineInstrBuilder.h" ----
34 #include "llvm/CodeGen/MachinePostDominators.h" ----
35 #include "llvm/CodeGen/MachineRegisterInfo.h" ----
36 #include "llvm/InitializePasses.h" ----
37 #include "llvm/Support/Debug.h" ----
38 ----
39 using namespace llvm; ----
40 ----
41 #define DEBUG_TYPE "ppc-mi-peepholes" ----
42 ----
43 STATISTIC(RemoveTOCSave, "Number of TOC saves removed"); ----
44 STATISTIC(MultiTOCSaves, ----
45 "Number of functions with multiple TOC saves that must be kept"); ----
46 STATISTIC(NumTOCSavesInPrologue, "Number of TOC saves placed in the prologue"); ----
47 STATISTIC(NumEliminatedSExt, "Number of eliminated sign-extensions"); ----
48 STATISTIC(NumEliminatedZExt, "Number of eliminated zero-extensions"); ----
49 STATISTIC(NumOptADDLIs, "Number of optimized ADD instruction fed by LI"); ----
50 STATISTIC(NumConvertedToImmediateForm, ----
51 "Number of instructions converted to their immediate form"); ----
52 STATISTIC(NumFunctionsEnteredInMIPeephole, ----
53 "Number of functions entered in PPC MI Peepholes"); ----
54 STATISTIC(NumFixedPointIterations, ----
55 "Number of fixed-point iterations converting reg-reg instructions " ----
56 "to reg-imm ones"); ----
57 STATISTIC(NumRotatesCollapsed, ----
58 "Number of pairs of rotate left, clear left/right collapsed"); ----
59 STATISTIC(NumEXTSWAndSLDICombined, ----
60 "Number of pairs of EXTSW and SLDI combined as EXTSWSLI"); ----
61 STATISTIC(NumLoadImmZeroFoldedAndRemoved, ----
62 "Number of LI(8) reg, 0 that are folded to r0 and removed"); ----
63 ----
64 static cl::opt ----
65 FixedPointRegToImm("ppc-reg-to-imm-fixed-point", cl::Hidden, cl::init(true), ----
66 cl::desc("Iterate to a fixed point when attempting to " ----
67 "convert reg-reg instructions to reg-imm")); ----
68 ----
69 static cl::opt ----
70 ConvertRegReg("ppc-convert-rr-to-ri", cl::Hidden, cl::init(true), ----
71 cl::desc("Convert eligible reg+reg instructions to reg+imm")); ----
72 ----
73 static cl::opt ----
74 EnableSExtElimination("ppc-eliminate-signext", ----
75 cl::desc("enable elimination of sign-extensions"), ----
76 cl::init(true), cl::Hidden); ----
77 ----
78 static cl::opt ----
79 EnableZExtElimination("ppc-eliminate-zeroext", ----
80 cl::desc("enable elimination of zero-extensions"), ----
81 cl::init(true), cl::Hidden); ----
82 ----
83 static cl::opt ----
84 EnableTrapOptimization("ppc-opt-conditional-trap", ----
85 cl::desc("enable optimization of conditional traps"), ----
86 cl::init(false), cl::Hidden); ----

88 namespace { ----
89 ----
90 struct PPCMIPeephole : public MachineFunctionPass { ----
91 ----
92 static char ID; ----
93 const PPCInstrInfo *TII; ----
94 MachineFunction *MF; ----
95 MachineRegisterInfo *MRI; ----
96 ----
97 PPCMIPeephole() : MachineFunctionPass(ID) { 0
98 initializePPCMIPeepholePass(*PassRegistry::getPassRegistry()); 0
99 } 0
100 ----
101 private: ----
102 MachineDominatorTree *MDT; ----
103 MachinePostDominatorTree *MPDT; ----
104 MachineBlockFrequencyInfo *MBFI; ----
105 uint64_t EntryFreq; ----
106 ----
107 // Initialize class variables. ----
108 void initialize(MachineFunction &MFParm); ----
109 ----
110 // Perform peepholes. ----
111 bool simplifyCode(); ----
112 ----
113 // Perform peepholes. ----
114 bool eliminateRedundantCompare(); ----
115 bool eliminateRedundantTOCSaves(std::map &TOCSaves); ----
116 bool combineSEXTAndSHL(MachineInstr &MI, MachineInstr *&ToErase); ----
117 bool emitRLDICWhenLoweringJumpTables(MachineInstr &MI); ----
118 void UpdateTOCSaves(std::map &TOCSaves, ----
119 MachineInstr *MI); ----
120 ----
121 public: ----
122 ----
123 void getAnalysisUsage(AnalysisUsage &AU) const override { 0
124 AU.addRequired(); 0
125 AU.addRequired(); 0
126 AU.addRequired(); 0
127 AU.addPreserved(); 0
128 AU.addPreserved(); 0
129 AU.addPreserved(); 0
130 MachineFunctionPass::getAnalysisUsage(AU); 0
131 } 0
132 ----
133 // Main entry point for this pass. ----
134 bool runOnMachineFunction(MachineFunction &MF) override { 0
135 initialize(MF); 0
136 // At this point, TOC pointer should not be used in a function that uses ----
137 // PC-Relative addressing. ----
138 assert((MF.getRegInfo().use_empty(PPC::X2) || 0
139 !MF.getSubtarget().isUsingPCRelativeCalls()) && ----
140 "TOC pointer used in a function using PC-Relative addressing!"); ----
141 if (skipFunction(MF.getFunction())) 0
142 return false; 0
143 return simplifyCode(); 0
144 } ----
145 }; ----
146 ----
147 // Initialize class variables. ----
148 void PPCMIPeephole::initialize(MachineFunction &MFParm) { 0
149 MF = &MFParm; 0
150 MRI = &MF->getRegInfo(); 0
151 MDT = &getAnalysis(); 0
152 MPDT = &getAnalysis(); 0
153 MBFI = &getAnalysis(); 0
154 EntryFreq = MBFI->getEntryFreq(); 0
155 TII = MF->getSubtarget().getInstrInfo(); 0
156 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "*** PowerPC MI peephole pass ***\n\n"); 0
157 LLVM_DEBUG(MF->dump()); 0
158 } 0
159 ----
160 static MachineInstr *getVRegDefOrNull(MachineOperand *Op, 0
161 MachineRegisterInfo *MRI) { ----
162 assert(Op && "Invalid Operand!"); 0
163 if (!Op->isReg()) 0
164 return nullptr; 0
165 ----
166 Register Reg = Op->getReg(); 0
167 if (!Reg.isVirtual()) 0
168 return nullptr; 0
169 ----
170 return MRI->getVRegDef(Reg); 0
171 } ----
172 ----
173 // This function returns number of known zero bits in output of MI ----
174 // starting from the most significant bit. ----
175 static unsigned getKnownLeadingZeroCount(const unsigned Reg, 0
176 const PPCInstrInfo *TII, ----
177 const MachineRegisterInfo *MRI) { ----
178 MachineInstr *MI = MRI->getVRegDef(Reg); 0
179 unsigned Opcode = MI->getOpcode(); 0
180 if (Opcode == PPC::RLDICL || Opcode == PPC::RLDICL_rec || 0
181 Opcode == PPC::RLDCL || Opcode == PPC::RLDCL_rec) 0
182 return MI->getOperand(3).getImm(); 0
183 ----
184 if ((Opcode == PPC::RLDIC || Opcode == PPC::RLDIC_rec) && 0
185 MI->getOperand(3).getImm() <= 63 - MI->getOperand(2).getImm()) 0
186 return MI->getOperand(3).getImm(); 0
187 ----
188 if ((Opcode == PPC::RLWINM || Opcode == PPC::RLWINM_rec || 0
189 Opcode == PPC::RLWNM || Opcode == PPC::RLWNM_rec || 0
190 Opcode == PPC::RLWINM8 || Opcode == PPC::RLWNM8) && 0
191 MI->getOperand(3).getImm() <= MI->getOperand(4).getImm()) 0
192 return 32 + MI->getOperand(3).getImm(); 0
193 ----
194 if (Opcode == PPC::ANDI_rec) { 0
195 uint16_t Imm = MI->getOperand(2).getImm(); 0
196 return 48 + llvm::countl_zero(Imm); 0
197 } ----
198 ----
199 if (Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW || Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW_rec || 0
200 Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW_rec || 0
201 Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW8 || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW8) 0
202 // The result ranges from 0 to 32. ----
203 return 58; 0
204 ----
205 if (Opcode == PPC::CNTLZD || Opcode == PPC::CNTLZD_rec || 0
206 Opcode == PPC::CNTTZD || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZD_rec) 0
207 // The result ranges from 0 to 64. ----
208 return 57; 0
209 ----
210 if (Opcode == PPC::LHZ || Opcode == PPC::LHZX || 0
211 Opcode == PPC::LHZ8 || Opcode == PPC::LHZX8 || 0
212 Opcode == PPC::LHZU || Opcode == PPC::LHZUX || 0
213 Opcode == PPC::LHZU8 || Opcode == PPC::LHZUX8) 0
214 return 48; 0
215 ----
216 if (Opcode == PPC::LBZ || Opcode == PPC::LBZX || 0
217 Opcode == PPC::LBZ8 || Opcode == PPC::LBZX8 || 0
218 Opcode == PPC::LBZU || Opcode == PPC::LBZUX || 0
219 Opcode == PPC::LBZU8 || Opcode == PPC::LBZUX8) 0
220 return 56; 0
221 ----
222 if (Opcode == PPC::AND || Opcode == PPC::AND8 || Opcode == PPC::AND_rec || 0
223 Opcode == PPC::AND8_rec) ----
224 return std::max( 0
225 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(1).getReg(), TII, MRI), 0
226 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(2).getReg(), TII, MRI)); 0
227 ----
228 if (Opcode == PPC::OR || Opcode == PPC::OR8 || Opcode == PPC::XOR || 0
229 Opcode == PPC::XOR8 || Opcode == PPC::OR_rec || 0
230 Opcode == PPC::OR8_rec || Opcode == PPC::XOR_rec || 0
231 Opcode == PPC::XOR8_rec) ----
232 return std::min( 0
233 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(1).getReg(), TII, MRI), 0
234 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(2).getReg(), TII, MRI)); 0
235 ----
236 if (TII->isZeroExtended(Reg, MRI)) 0
237 return 32; 0
238 ----
239 return 0; 0
240 } ----
241 ----
242 // This function maintains a map for the pairs ----
243 // Each time a new TOC save is encountered, it checks if any of the existing ----
244 // ones are dominated by the new one. If so, it marks the existing one as ----
245 // redundant by setting it's entry in the map as false. It then adds the new ----
246 // instruction to the map with either true or false depending on if any ----
247 // existing instructions dominated the new one. ----
248 void PPCMIPeephole::UpdateTOCSaves( 0
249 std::map &TOCSaves, MachineInstr *MI) { ----
250 assert(TII->isTOCSaveMI(*MI) && "Expecting a TOC save instruction here"); 0
251 // FIXME: Saving TOC in prologue hasn't been implemented well in AIX ABI part, ----
252 // here only support it under ELFv2. ----
253 if (MF->getSubtarget().isELFv2ABI()) { 0
254 PPCFunctionInfo *FI = MF->getInfo(); 0
255 ----
256 MachineBasicBlock *Entry = &MF->front(); 0
257 uint64_t CurrBlockFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(MI->getParent()).getFrequency(); 0
258 ----
259 // If the block in which the TOC save resides is in a block that ----
260 // post-dominates Entry, or a block that is hotter than entry (keep in mind ----
261 // that early MachineLICM has already run so the TOC save won't be hoisted) ----
262 // we can just do the save in the prologue. ----
263 if (CurrBlockFreq > EntryFreq || MPDT->dominates(MI->getParent(), Entry)) 0
264 FI->setMustSaveTOC(true); 0
265 ----
266 // If we are saving the TOC in the prologue, all the TOC saves can be ----
267 // removed from the code. ----
268 if (FI->mustSaveTOC()) { 0
269 for (auto &TOCSave : TOCSaves) 0
270 TOCSave.second = false; 0
271 // Add new instruction to map. ----
272 TOCSaves[MI] = false; 0
273 return; 0
274 } ----
275 } ----
276 ----
277 bool Keep = true; 0
278 for (auto &I : TOCSaves) { 0
279 MachineInstr *CurrInst = I.first; 0
280 // If new instruction dominates an existing one, mark existing one as ----
281 // redundant. ----
282 if (I.second && MDT->dominates(MI, CurrInst)) 0
283 I.second = false; 0
284 // Check if the new instruction is redundant. ----
285 if (MDT->dominates(CurrInst, MI)) { 0
286 Keep = false; 0
287 break; 0
288 } ----
289 } ----
290 // Add new instruction to map. ----
291 TOCSaves[MI] = Keep; 0
292 } ----
293 ----
294 // This function returns a list of all PHI nodes in the tree starting from ----
295 // the RootPHI node. We perform a BFS traversal to get an ordered list of nodes. ----
296 // The list initially only contains the root PHI. When we visit a PHI node, we ----
297 // add it to the list. We continue to look for other PHI node operands while ----
298 // there are nodes to visit in the list. The function returns false if the ----
299 // optimization cannot be applied on this tree. ----
300 static bool collectUnprimedAccPHIs(MachineRegisterInfo *MRI, 0
301 MachineInstr *RootPHI, ----
302 SmallVectorImpl &PHIs) { ----
303 PHIs.push_back(RootPHI); 0
304 unsigned VisitedIndex = 0; 0
305 while (VisitedIndex < PHIs.size()) { 0
306 MachineInstr *VisitedPHI = PHIs[VisitedIndex]; 0
307 for (unsigned PHIOp = 1, NumOps = VisitedPHI->getNumOperands(); 0
308 PHIOp != NumOps; PHIOp += 2) { 0
309 Register RegOp = VisitedPHI->getOperand(PHIOp).getReg(); 0
310 if (!RegOp.isVirtual()) 0
311 return false; 0
312 MachineInstr *Instr = MRI->getVRegDef(RegOp); 0
313 // While collecting the PHI nodes, we check if they can be converted (i.e. ----
314 // all the operands are either copies, implicit defs or PHI nodes). ----
315 unsigned Opcode = Instr->getOpcode(); 0
316 if (Opcode == PPC::COPY) { 0
317 Register Reg = Instr->getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
318 if (!Reg.isVirtual() || MRI->getRegClass(Reg) != &PPC::ACCRCRegClass) 0
319 return false; 0
320 } else if (Opcode != PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF && Opcode != PPC::PHI) 0
321 return false; 0
322 // If we detect a cycle in the PHI nodes, we exit. It would be ----
323 // possible to change cycles as well, but that would add a lot ----
324 // of complexity for a case that is unlikely to occur with MMA ----
325 // code. ----
326 if (Opcode != PPC::PHI) 0
327 continue; 0
328 if (llvm::is_contained(PHIs, Instr)) 0
329 return false; 0
330 PHIs.push_back(Instr); 0
331 } ----
332 VisitedIndex++; 0
333 } ----
334 return true; 0
335 } ----
336 ----
337 // This function changes the unprimed accumulator PHI nodes in the PHIs list to ----
338 // primed accumulator PHI nodes. The list is traversed in reverse order to ----
339 // change all the PHI operands of a PHI node before changing the node itself. ----
340 // We keep a map to associate each changed PHI node to its non-changed form. ----
341 static void convertUnprimedAccPHIs(const PPCInstrInfo *TII, 0
342 MachineRegisterInfo *MRI, ----
343 SmallVectorImpl &PHIs, ----
344 Register Dst) { ----
345 DenseMap ChangedPHIMap; 0
346 for (MachineInstr *PHI : llvm::reverse(PHIs)) { 0
347 SmallVector, 4> PHIOps; 0
348 // We check if the current PHI node can be changed by looking at its ----
349 // operands. If all the operands are either copies from primed ----
350 // accumulators, implicit definitions or other unprimed accumulator ----
351 // PHI nodes, we change it. ----
352 for (unsigned PHIOp = 1, NumOps = PHI->getNumOperands(); PHIOp != NumOps; 0
353 PHIOp += 2) { 0
354 Register RegOp = PHI->getOperand(PHIOp).getReg(); 0
355 MachineInstr *PHIInput = MRI->getVRegDef(RegOp); 0
356 unsigned Opcode = PHIInput->getOpcode(); 0
357 assert((Opcode == PPC::COPY || Opcode == PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF || 0
358 Opcode == PPC::PHI) && ----
359 "Unexpected instruction"); ----
360 if (Opcode == PPC::COPY) { 0
361 assert(MRI->getRegClass(PHIInput->getOperand(1).getReg()) == 0
362 &PPC::ACCRCRegClass && ----
363 "Unexpected register class"); ----
364 PHIOps.push_back({PHIInput->getOperand(1), PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)}); 0
365 } else if (Opcode == PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF) { 0
366 Register AccReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::ACCRCRegClass); 0
367 BuildMI(*PHIInput->getParent(), PHIInput, PHIInput->getDebugLoc(), 0
368 TII->get(PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF), AccReg); ----
369 PHIOps.push_back({MachineOperand::CreateReg(AccReg, false), 0
370 PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)}); ----
371 } else if (Opcode == PPC::PHI) { 0
372 // We found a PHI operand. At this point we know this operand ----
373 // has already been changed so we get its associated changed form ----
374 // from the map. ----
375 assert(ChangedPHIMap.count(PHIInput) == 1 && 0
376 "This PHI node should have already been changed."); ----
377 MachineInstr *PrimedAccPHI = ChangedPHIMap.lookup(PHIInput); 0
378 PHIOps.push_back({MachineOperand::CreateReg( 0
379 PrimedAccPHI->getOperand(0).getReg(), false), 0
380 PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)}); ----
381 } ----
382 } ----
383 Register AccReg = Dst; 0
384 // If the PHI node we are changing is the root node, the register it defines ----
385 // will be the destination register of the original copy (of the PHI def). ----
386 // For all other PHI's in the list, we need to create another primed ----
387 // accumulator virtual register as the PHI will no longer define the ----
388 // unprimed accumulator. ----
389 if (PHI != PHIs[0]) 0
390 AccReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::ACCRCRegClass); 0
391 MachineInstrBuilder NewPHI = BuildMI( 0
392 *PHI->getParent(), PHI, PHI->getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::PHI), AccReg); 0
393 for (auto RegMBB : PHIOps) 0
394 NewPHI.add(RegMBB.first).add(RegMBB.second); 0
395 ChangedPHIMap[PHI] = NewPHI.getInstr(); 0
396 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converting PHI: "); 0
397 LLVM_DEBUG(PHI->dump()); 0
398 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "To: "); 0
399 LLVM_DEBUG(NewPHI.getInstr()->dump()); 0
400 } 0
401 } 0
402 ----
403 // Perform peephole optimizations. ----
404 bool PPCMIPeephole::simplifyCode() { 0
405 bool Simplified = false; 0
406 bool TrapOpt = false; 0
407 MachineInstr* ToErase = nullptr; 0
408 std::map TOCSaves; 0
409 const TargetRegisterInfo *TRI = &TII->getRegisterInfo(); 0
410 NumFunctionsEnteredInMIPeephole++; 0
411 if (ConvertRegReg) { 0
412 // Fixed-point conversion of reg/reg instructions fed by load-immediate ----
413 // into reg/imm instructions. FIXME: This is expensive, control it with ----
414 // an option. ----
415 bool SomethingChanged = false; 0
416 do { ----
417 NumFixedPointIterations++; 0
418 SomethingChanged = false; 0
419 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *MF) { 0
420 for (MachineInstr &MI : MBB) { 0
421 if (MI.isDebugInstr()) 0
422 continue; 0
423 ----
424 if (TII->convertToImmediateForm(MI)) { 0
425 // We don't erase anything in case the def has other uses. Let DCE ----
426 // remove it if it can be removed. ----
427 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converted instruction to imm form: "); 0
428 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
429 NumConvertedToImmediateForm++; 0
430 SomethingChanged = true; 0
431 Simplified = true; 0
432 continue; 0
433 } ----
434 } ----
435 } ----
436 } while (SomethingChanged && FixedPointRegToImm); 0
437 } ----
438 ----
439 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *MF) { 0
440 for (MachineInstr &MI : MBB) { 0
441 ----
442 // If the previous instruction was marked for elimination, ----
443 // remove it now. ----
444 if (ToErase) { 0
445 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Deleting instruction: "); 0
446 LLVM_DEBUG(ToErase->dump()); 0
447 ToErase->eraseFromParent(); 0
448 ToErase = nullptr; 0
449 } ----
450 // If a conditional trap instruction got optimized to an ----
451 // unconditional trap, eliminate all the instructions after ----
452 // the trap. ----
453 if (EnableTrapOptimization && TrapOpt) { 0
454 ToErase = &MI; 0
455 continue; 0
456 } ----
457 ----
458 // Ignore debug instructions. ----
459 if (MI.isDebugInstr()) 0
460 continue; 0
461 ----
462 // Per-opcode peepholes. ----
463 switch (MI.getOpcode()) { 0
464 ----
465 default: 0
466 break; 0
467 case PPC::COPY: { 0
468 Register Src = MI.getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
469 Register Dst = MI.getOperand(0).getReg(); 0
470 if (!Src.isVirtual() || !Dst.isVirtual()) 0
471 break; 0
472 if (MRI->getRegClass(Src) != &PPC::UACCRCRegClass || 0
473 MRI->getRegClass(Dst) != &PPC::ACCRCRegClass) 0
474 break; 0
475 ----
476 // We are copying an unprimed accumulator to a primed accumulator. ----
477 // If the input to the copy is a PHI that is fed only by (i) copies in ----
478 // the other direction (ii) implicitly defined unprimed accumulators or ----
479 // (iii) other PHI nodes satisfying (i) and (ii), we can change ----
480 // the PHI to a PHI on primed accumulators (as long as we also change ----
481 // its operands). To detect and change such copies, we first get a list ----
482 // of all the PHI nodes starting from the root PHI node in BFS order. ----
483 // We then visit all these PHI nodes to check if they can be changed to ----
484 // primed accumulator PHI nodes and if so, we change them. ----
485 MachineInstr *RootPHI = MRI->getVRegDef(Src); 0
486 if (RootPHI->getOpcode() != PPC::PHI) 0
487 break; 0
488 ----
489 SmallVector PHIs; 0
490 if (!collectUnprimedAccPHIs(MRI, RootPHI, PHIs)) 0
491 break; 0
492 ----
493 convertUnprimedAccPHIs(TII, MRI, PHIs, Dst); 0
494 ----
495 ToErase = &MI; 0
496 break; 0
497 } 0
498 case PPC::LI: 0
499 case PPC::LI8: { ----
500 // If we are materializing a zero, look for any use operands for which ----
501 // zero means immediate zero. All such operands can be replaced with ----
502 // PPC::ZERO. ----
503 if (!MI.getOperand(1).isImm() || MI.getOperand(1).getImm() != 0) 0
504 break; 0
505 Register MIDestReg = MI.getOperand(0).getReg(); 0
506 for (MachineInstr& UseMI : MRI->use_instructions(MIDestReg)) 0
507 Simplified |= TII->onlyFoldImmediate(UseMI, MI, MIDestReg); 0
508 if (MRI->use_nodbg_empty(MIDestReg)) { 0
509 ++NumLoadImmZeroFoldedAndRemoved; 0
510 ToErase = &MI; 0
511 } ----
512 break; 0
513 } ----
514 case PPC::STW: 0
515 case PPC::STD: { ----
516 MachineFrameInfo &MFI = MF->getFrameInfo(); 0
517 if (MFI.hasVarSizedObjects() || 0
518 (!MF->getSubtarget().isELFv2ABI() && 0
519 !MF->getSubtarget().isAIXABI())) 0
520 break; 0
521 // When encountering a TOC save instruction, call UpdateTOCSaves ----
522 // to add it to the TOCSaves map and mark any existing TOC saves ----
523 // it dominates as redundant. ----
524 if (TII->isTOCSaveMI(MI)) 0
525 UpdateTOCSaves(TOCSaves, &MI); 0
526 break; 0
527 } ----
528 case PPC::XXPERMDI: { 0
529 // Perform simplifications of 2x64 vector swaps and splats. ----
530 // A swap is identified by an immediate value of 2, and a splat ----
531 // is identified by an immediate value of 0 or 3. ----
532 int Immed = MI.getOperand(3).getImm(); 0
533 ----
534 if (Immed == 1) 0
535 break; 0
536 ----
537 // For each of these simplifications, we need the two source ----
538 // regs to match. Unfortunately, MachineCSE ignores COPY and ----
539 // SUBREG_TO_REG, so for example we can see ----
540 // XXPERMDI t, SUBREG_TO_REG(s), SUBREG_TO_REG(s), immed. ----
541 // We have to look through chains of COPY and SUBREG_TO_REG ----
542 // to find the real source values for comparison. ----
543 Register TrueReg1 = ----
544 TRI->lookThruCopyLike(MI.getOperand(1).getReg(), MRI); 0
545 Register TrueReg2 = ----
546 TRI->lookThruCopyLike(MI.getOperand(2).getReg(), MRI); 0
547 ----
548 if (!(TrueReg1 == TrueReg2 && TrueReg1.isVirtual())) 0
549 break; 0
550 ----
551 MachineInstr *DefMI = MRI->getVRegDef(TrueReg1); 0
552 ----
553 if (!DefMI) 0
554 break; 0
555 ----
556 unsigned DefOpc = DefMI->getOpcode(); 0
557 ----
558 // If this is a splat fed by a splatting load, the splat is ----
559 // redundant. Replace with a copy. This doesn't happen directly due ----
560 // to code in PPCDAGToDAGISel.cpp, but it can happen when converting ----
561 // a load of a double to a vector of 64-bit integers. ----
562 auto isConversionOfLoadAndSplat = [=]() -> bool { 0
563 if (DefOpc != PPC::XVCVDPSXDS && DefOpc != PPC::XVCVDPUXDS) 0
564 return false; 0
565 Register FeedReg1 = ----
566 TRI->lookThruCopyLike(DefMI->getOperand(1).getReg(), MRI); 0
567 if (FeedReg1.isVirtual()) { 0
568 MachineInstr *LoadMI = MRI->getVRegDef(FeedReg1); 0
569 if (LoadMI && LoadMI->getOpcode() == PPC::LXVDSX) 0
570 return true; 0
571 } ----
572 return false; 0
573 }; 0
574 if ((Immed == 0 || Immed == 3) && 0
575 (DefOpc == PPC::LXVDSX || isConversionOfLoadAndSplat())) { 0
576 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimizing load-and-splat/splat " 0
577 "to load-and-splat/copy: "); ----
578 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
579 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
580 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
581 .add(MI.getOperand(1)); 0
582 ToErase = &MI; 0
583 Simplified = true; 0
584 } ----
585 ----
586 // If this is a splat or a swap fed by another splat, we ----
587 // can replace it with a copy. ----
588 if (DefOpc == PPC::XXPERMDI) { 0
589 Register DefReg1 = DefMI->getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
590 Register DefReg2 = DefMI->getOperand(2).getReg(); 0
591 unsigned DefImmed = DefMI->getOperand(3).getImm(); 0
592 ----
593 // If the two inputs are not the same register, check to see if ----
594 // they originate from the same virtual register after only ----
595 // copy-like instructions. ----
596 if (DefReg1 != DefReg2) { 0
597 Register FeedReg1 = TRI->lookThruCopyLike(DefReg1, MRI); 0
598 Register FeedReg2 = TRI->lookThruCopyLike(DefReg2, MRI); 0
599 ----
600 if (!(FeedReg1 == FeedReg2 && FeedReg1.isVirtual())) 0
601 break; 0
602 } ----
603 ----
604 if (DefImmed == 0 || DefImmed == 3) { 0
605 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimizing splat/swap or splat/splat " 0
606 "to splat/copy: "); ----
607 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
608 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
609 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
610 .add(MI.getOperand(1)); 0
611 ToErase = &MI; 0
612 Simplified = true; 0
613 } ----
614 ----
615 // If this is a splat fed by a swap, we can simplify modify ----
616 // the splat to splat the other value from the swap's input ----
617 // parameter. ----
618 else if ((Immed == 0 || Immed == 3) && DefImmed == 2) { 0
619 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimizing swap/splat => splat: "); 0
620 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
621 MI.getOperand(1).setReg(DefReg1); 0
622 MI.getOperand(2).setReg(DefReg2); 0
623 MI.getOperand(3).setImm(3 - Immed); 0
624 Simplified = true; 0
625 } ----
626 ----
627 // If this is a swap fed by a swap, we can replace it ----
628 // with a copy from the first swap's input. ----
629 else if (Immed == 2 && DefImmed == 2) { 0
630 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimizing swap/swap => copy: "); 0
631 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
632 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
633 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
634 .add(DefMI->getOperand(1)); 0
635 ToErase = &MI; 0
636 Simplified = true; 0
637 } ----
638 } else if ((Immed == 0 || Immed == 3 || Immed == 2) && 0
639 DefOpc == PPC::XXPERMDIs && 0
640 (DefMI->getOperand(2).getImm() == 0 || 0
641 DefMI->getOperand(2).getImm() == 3)) { 0
642 ToErase = &MI; 0
643 Simplified = true; 0
644 // Swap of a splat, convert to copy. ----
645 if (Immed == 2) { 0
646 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimizing swap(splat) => copy(splat): "); 0
647 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
648 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
649 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
650 .add(MI.getOperand(1)); 0
651 break; 0
652 } ----
653 // Splat fed by another splat - switch the output of the first ----
654 // and remove the second. ----
655 DefMI->getOperand(0).setReg(MI.getOperand(0).getReg()); 0
656 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Removing redundant splat: "); 0
657 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
658 } else if (Immed == 2 && 0
659 (DefOpc == PPC::VSPLTB || DefOpc == PPC::VSPLTH || 0
660 DefOpc == PPC::VSPLTW || DefOpc == PPC::XXSPLTW || 0
661 DefOpc == PPC::VSPLTISB || DefOpc == PPC::VSPLTISH || 0
662 DefOpc == PPC::VSPLTISW)) { ----
663 // Swap of various vector splats, convert to copy. ----
664 ToErase = &MI; 0
665 Simplified = true; 0
666 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimizing swap(vsplt(is)?[b|h|w]|xxspltw) => " 0
667 "copy(vsplt(is)?[b|h|w]|xxspltw): "); ----
668 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
669 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
670 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
671 .add(MI.getOperand(1)); 0
672 } else if ((Immed == 0 || Immed == 3 || Immed == 2) && 0
673 TII->isLoadFromConstantPool(DefMI)) { 0
674 const Constant *C = TII->getConstantFromConstantPool(DefMI); 0
675 if (C && C->getType()->isVectorTy() && C->getSplatValue()) { 0
676 ToErase = &MI; 0
677 Simplified = true; 0
678 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() 0
679 << "Optimizing swap(splat pattern from constant-pool) " ----
680 "=> copy(splat pattern from constant-pool): "); ----
681 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
682 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
683 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
684 .add(MI.getOperand(1)); 0
685 } ----
686 } ----
687 break; 0
688 } ----
689 case PPC::VSPLTB: 0
690 case PPC::VSPLTH: ----
691 case PPC::XXSPLTW: { ----
692 unsigned MyOpcode = MI.getOpcode(); 0
693 unsigned OpNo = MyOpcode == PPC::XXSPLTW ? 1 : 2; 0
694 Register TrueReg = ----
695 TRI->lookThruCopyLike(MI.getOperand(OpNo).getReg(), MRI); 0
696 if (!TrueReg.isVirtual()) 0
697 break; 0
698 MachineInstr *DefMI = MRI->getVRegDef(TrueReg); 0
699 if (!DefMI) 0
700 break; 0
701 unsigned DefOpcode = DefMI->getOpcode(); 0
702 auto isConvertOfSplat = [=]() -> bool { 0
703 if (DefOpcode != PPC::XVCVSPSXWS && DefOpcode != PPC::XVCVSPUXWS) 0
704 return false; 0
705 Register ConvReg = DefMI->getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
706 if (!ConvReg.isVirtual()) 0
707 return false; 0
708 MachineInstr *Splt = MRI->getVRegDef(ConvReg); 0
709 return Splt && (Splt->getOpcode() == PPC::LXVWSX || 0
710 Splt->getOpcode() == PPC::XXSPLTW); 0
711 }; 0
712 bool AlreadySplat = (MyOpcode == DefOpcode) || 0
713 (MyOpcode == PPC::VSPLTB && DefOpcode == PPC::VSPLTBs) || 0
714 (MyOpcode == PPC::VSPLTH && DefOpcode == PPC::VSPLTHs) || 0
715 (MyOpcode == PPC::XXSPLTW && DefOpcode == PPC::XXSPLTWs) || 0
716 (MyOpcode == PPC::XXSPLTW && DefOpcode == PPC::LXVWSX) || 0
717 (MyOpcode == PPC::XXSPLTW && DefOpcode == PPC::MTVSRWS)|| 0
718 (MyOpcode == PPC::XXSPLTW && isConvertOfSplat()); 0
719 // If the instruction[s] that feed this splat have already splat ----
720 // the value, this splat is redundant. ----
721 if (AlreadySplat) { 0
722 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Changing redundant splat to a copy: "); 0
723 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
724 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
725 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
726 .add(MI.getOperand(OpNo)); 0
727 ToErase = &MI; 0
728 Simplified = true; 0
729 } ----
730 // Splat fed by a shift. Usually when we align value to splat into ----
731 // vector element zero. ----
732 if (DefOpcode == PPC::XXSLDWI) { 0
733 Register ShiftRes = DefMI->getOperand(0).getReg(); 0
734 Register ShiftOp1 = DefMI->getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
735 Register ShiftOp2 = DefMI->getOperand(2).getReg(); 0
736 unsigned ShiftImm = DefMI->getOperand(3).getImm(); 0
737 unsigned SplatImm = ----
738 MI.getOperand(MyOpcode == PPC::XXSPLTW ? 2 : 1).getImm(); 0
739 if (ShiftOp1 == ShiftOp2) { 0
740 unsigned NewElem = (SplatImm + ShiftImm) & 0x3; 0
741 if (MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(ShiftRes)) { 0
742 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Removing redundant shift: "); 0
743 LLVM_DEBUG(DefMI->dump()); 0
744 ToErase = DefMI; 0
745 } ----
746 Simplified = true; 0
747 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Changing splat immediate from " << SplatImm 0
748 << " to " << NewElem << " in instruction: "); ----
749 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
750 MI.getOperand(1).setReg(ShiftOp1); 0
751 MI.getOperand(2).setImm(NewElem); 0
752 } ----
753 } ----
754 break; 0
755 } ----
756 case PPC::XVCVDPSP: { 0
757 // If this is a DP->SP conversion fed by an FRSP, the FRSP is redundant. ----
758 Register TrueReg = ----
759 TRI->lookThruCopyLike(MI.getOperand(1).getReg(), MRI); 0
760 if (!TrueReg.isVirtual()) 0
761 break; 0
762 MachineInstr *DefMI = MRI->getVRegDef(TrueReg); 0
763 ----
764 // This can occur when building a vector of single precision or integer ----
765 // values. ----
766 if (DefMI && DefMI->getOpcode() == PPC::XXPERMDI) { 0
767 Register DefsReg1 = ----
768 TRI->lookThruCopyLike(DefMI->getOperand(1).getReg(), MRI); 0
769 Register DefsReg2 = ----
770 TRI->lookThruCopyLike(DefMI->getOperand(2).getReg(), MRI); 0
771 if (!DefsReg1.isVirtual() || !DefsReg2.isVirtual()) 0
772 break; 0
773 MachineInstr *P1 = MRI->getVRegDef(DefsReg1); 0
774 MachineInstr *P2 = MRI->getVRegDef(DefsReg2); 0
775 ----
776 if (!P1 || !P2) 0
777 break; ----
778 ----
779 // Remove the passed FRSP/XSRSP instruction if it only feeds this MI ----
780 // and set any uses of that FRSP/XSRSP (in this MI) to the source of ----
781 // the FRSP/XSRSP. ----
782 auto removeFRSPIfPossible = [&](MachineInstr *RoundInstr) { 0
783 unsigned Opc = RoundInstr->getOpcode(); 0
784 if ((Opc == PPC::FRSP || Opc == PPC::XSRSP) && 0
785 MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(RoundInstr->getOperand(0).getReg())) { 0
786 Simplified = true; 0
787 Register ConvReg1 = RoundInstr->getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
788 Register FRSPDefines = RoundInstr->getOperand(0).getReg(); 0
789 MachineInstr &Use = *(MRI->use_instr_nodbg_begin(FRSPDefines)); 0
790 for (int i = 0, e = Use.getNumOperands(); i < e; ++i) 0
791 if (Use.getOperand(i).isReg() && 0
792 Use.getOperand(i).getReg() == FRSPDefines) 0
793 Use.getOperand(i).setReg(ConvReg1); 0
794 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Removing redundant FRSP/XSRSP:\n"); 0
795 LLVM_DEBUG(RoundInstr->dump()); 0
796 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "As it feeds instruction:\n"); 0
797 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
798 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Through instruction:\n"); 0
799 LLVM_DEBUG(DefMI->dump()); 0
800 RoundInstr->eraseFromParent(); 0
801 } ----
802 }; 0
803 ----
804 // If the input to XVCVDPSP is a vector that was built (even ----
805 // partially) out of FRSP's, the FRSP(s) can safely be removed ----
806 // since this instruction performs the same operation. ----
807 if (P1 != P2) { 0
808 removeFRSPIfPossible(P1); 0
809 removeFRSPIfPossible(P2); 0
810 break; 0
811 } ----
812 removeFRSPIfPossible(P1); 0
813 } ----
814 break; 0
815 } ----
816 case PPC::EXTSH: 0
817 case PPC::EXTSH8: ----
818 case PPC::EXTSH8_32_64: { ----
819 if (!EnableSExtElimination) break; 0
820 Register NarrowReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
821 if (!NarrowReg.isVirtual()) 0
822 break; 0
823 ----
824 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(NarrowReg); 0
825 unsigned SrcOpcode = SrcMI->getOpcode(); 0
826 // If we've used a zero-extending load that we will sign-extend, ----
827 // just do a sign-extending load. ----
828 if (SrcOpcode == PPC::LHZ || SrcOpcode == PPC::LHZX) { 0
829 if (!MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(SrcMI->getOperand(0).getReg())) 0
830 break; 0
831 // Determine the new opcode. We need to make sure that if the original ----
832 // instruction has a 64 bit opcode we keep using a 64 bit opcode. ----
833 // Likewise if the source is X-Form the new opcode should also be ----
834 // X-Form. ----
835 unsigned Opc = PPC::LHA; 0
836 bool SourceIsXForm = SrcOpcode == PPC::LHZX; 0
837 bool MIIs64Bit = MI.getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSH8 || 0
838 MI.getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSH8_32_64; 0
839 ----
840 if (SourceIsXForm && MIIs64Bit) 0
841 Opc = PPC::LHAX8; 0
842 else if (SourceIsXForm && !MIIs64Bit) 0
843 Opc = PPC::LHAX; 0
844 else if (MIIs64Bit) 0
845 Opc = PPC::LHA8; 0
846 ----
847 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Zero-extending load\n"); 0
848 LLVM_DEBUG(SrcMI->dump()); 0
849 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "and sign-extension\n"); 0
850 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
851 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "are merged into sign-extending load\n"); 0
852 SrcMI->setDesc(TII->get(Opc)); 0
853 SrcMI->getOperand(0).setReg(MI.getOperand(0).getReg()); 0
854 ToErase = &MI; 0
855 Simplified = true; 0
856 NumEliminatedSExt++; 0
857 } ----
858 break; 0
859 } ----
860 case PPC::EXTSW: 0
861 case PPC::EXTSW_32: ----
862 case PPC::EXTSW_32_64: { ----
863 if (!EnableSExtElimination) break; 0
864 Register NarrowReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
865 if (!NarrowReg.isVirtual()) 0
866 break; 0
867 ----
868 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(NarrowReg); 0
869 unsigned SrcOpcode = SrcMI->getOpcode(); 0
870 // If we've used a zero-extending load that we will sign-extend, ----
871 // just do a sign-extending load. ----
872 if (SrcOpcode == PPC::LWZ || SrcOpcode == PPC::LWZX) { 0
873 if (!MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(SrcMI->getOperand(0).getReg())) 0
874 break; 0
875 ----
876 // The transformation from a zero-extending load to a sign-extending ----
877 // load is only legal when the displacement is a multiple of 4. ----
878 // If the displacement is not at least 4 byte aligned, don't perform ----
879 // the transformation. ----
880 bool IsWordAligned = false; 0
881 if (SrcMI->getOperand(1).isGlobal()) { 0
882 const GlobalObject *GO = ----
883 dyn_cast(SrcMI->getOperand(1).getGlobal()); 0
884 if (GO && GO->getAlign() && *GO->getAlign() >= 4 && 0
885 (SrcMI->getOperand(1).getOffset() % 4 == 0)) 0
886 IsWordAligned = true; 0
887 } else if (SrcMI->getOperand(1).isImm()) { 0
888 int64_t Value = SrcMI->getOperand(1).getImm(); 0
889 if (Value % 4 == 0) 0
890 IsWordAligned = true; 0
891 } ----
892 ----
893 // Determine the new opcode. We need to make sure that if the original ----
894 // instruction has a 64 bit opcode we keep using a 64 bit opcode. ----
895 // Likewise if the source is X-Form the new opcode should also be ----
896 // X-Form. ----
897 unsigned Opc = PPC::LWA_32; 0
898 bool SourceIsXForm = SrcOpcode == PPC::LWZX; 0
899 bool MIIs64Bit = MI.getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSW || 0
900 MI.getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSW_32_64; 0
901 ----
902 if (SourceIsXForm && MIIs64Bit) 0
903 Opc = PPC::LWAX; 0
904 else if (SourceIsXForm && !MIIs64Bit) 0
905 Opc = PPC::LWAX_32; 0
906 else if (MIIs64Bit) 0
907 Opc = PPC::LWA; 0
908 ----
909 if (!IsWordAligned && (Opc == PPC::LWA || Opc == PPC::LWA_32)) 0
910 break; ----
911 ----
912 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Zero-extending load\n"); 0
913 LLVM_DEBUG(SrcMI->dump()); 0
914 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "and sign-extension\n"); 0
915 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
916 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "are merged into sign-extending load\n"); 0
917 SrcMI->setDesc(TII->get(Opc)); 0
918 SrcMI->getOperand(0).setReg(MI.getOperand(0).getReg()); 0
919 ToErase = &MI; 0
920 Simplified = true; 0
921 NumEliminatedSExt++; 0
922 } else if (MI.getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSW_32_64 && 0
923 TII->isSignExtended(NarrowReg, MRI)) { 0
924 // We can eliminate EXTSW if the input is known to be already ----
925 // sign-extended. ----
926 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Removing redundant sign-extension\n"); 0
927 Register TmpReg = ----
928 MF->getRegInfo().createVirtualRegister(&PPC::G8RCRegClass); 0
929 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF), 0
930 TmpReg); ----
931 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::INSERT_SUBREG), 0
932 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
933 .addReg(TmpReg) 0
934 .addReg(NarrowReg) 0
935 .addImm(PPC::sub_32); 0
936 ToErase = &MI; 0
937 Simplified = true; 0
938 NumEliminatedSExt++; 0
939 } ----
940 break; 0
941 } ----
942 case PPC::RLDICL: { 0
943 // We can eliminate RLDICL (e.g. for zero-extension) ----
944 // if all bits to clear are already zero in the input. ----
945 // This code assume following code sequence for zero-extension. ----
946 // %6 = COPY %5:sub_32; (optional) ----
947 // %8 = IMPLICIT_DEF; ----
948 // %7 = INSERT_SUBREG %8, %6, sub_32; ----
949 if (!EnableZExtElimination) break; 0
950 ----
951 if (MI.getOperand(2).getImm() != 0) 0
952 break; 0
953 ----
954 Register SrcReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
955 if (!SrcReg.isVirtual()) 0
956 break; 0
957 ----
958 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcReg); 0
959 if (!(SrcMI && SrcMI->getOpcode() == PPC::INSERT_SUBREG && 0
960 SrcMI->getOperand(0).isReg() && SrcMI->getOperand(1).isReg())) 0
961 break; 0
962 ----
963 MachineInstr *ImpDefMI, *SubRegMI; ----
964 ImpDefMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcMI->getOperand(1).getReg()); 0
965 SubRegMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcMI->getOperand(2).getReg()); 0
966 if (ImpDefMI->getOpcode() != PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF) break; 0
967 ----
968 SrcMI = SubRegMI; 0
969 if (SubRegMI->getOpcode() == PPC::COPY) { 0
970 Register CopyReg = SubRegMI->getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
971 if (CopyReg.isVirtual()) 0
972 SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(CopyReg); 0
973 } ----
974 if (!SrcMI->getOperand(0).isReg()) 0
975 break; 0
976 ----
977 unsigned KnownZeroCount = ----
978 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(SrcMI->getOperand(0).getReg(), TII, MRI); 0
979 if (MI.getOperand(3).getImm() <= KnownZeroCount) { 0
980 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Removing redundant zero-extension\n"); 0
981 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
982 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
983 .addReg(SrcReg); 0
984 ToErase = &MI; 0
985 Simplified = true; 0
986 NumEliminatedZExt++; 0
987 } ----
988 break; 0
989 } ----
990 ----
991 // TODO: Any instruction that has an immediate form fed only by a PHI ----
992 // whose operands are all load immediate can be folded away. We currently ----
993 // do this for ADD instructions, but should expand it to arithmetic and ----
994 // binary instructions with immediate forms in the future. ----
995 case PPC::ADD4: 0
996 case PPC::ADD8: { ----
997 auto isSingleUsePHI = [&](MachineOperand *PhiOp) { 0
998 assert(PhiOp && "Invalid Operand!"); 0
999 MachineInstr *DefPhiMI = getVRegDefOrNull(PhiOp, MRI); 0
1000 ----
1001 return DefPhiMI && (DefPhiMI->getOpcode() == PPC::PHI) && 0
1002 MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(DefPhiMI->getOperand(0).getReg()); 0
1003 }; 0
1004 ----
1005 auto dominatesAllSingleUseLIs = [&](MachineOperand *DominatorOp, 0
1006 MachineOperand *PhiOp) { ----
1007 assert(PhiOp && "Invalid Operand!"); 0
1008 assert(DominatorOp && "Invalid Operand!"); 0
1009 MachineInstr *DefPhiMI = getVRegDefOrNull(PhiOp, MRI); 0
1010 MachineInstr *DefDomMI = getVRegDefOrNull(DominatorOp, MRI); 0
1011 ----
1012 // Note: the vregs only show up at odd indices position of PHI Node, ----
1013 // the even indices position save the BB info. ----
1014 for (unsigned i = 1; i < DefPhiMI->getNumOperands(); i += 2) { 0
1015 MachineInstr *LiMI = ----
1016 getVRegDefOrNull(&DefPhiMI->getOperand(i), MRI); 0
1017 if (!LiMI || 0
1018 (LiMI->getOpcode() != PPC::LI && LiMI->getOpcode() != PPC::LI8) 0
1019 || !MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(LiMI->getOperand(0).getReg()) || 0
1020 !MDT->dominates(DefDomMI, LiMI)) 0
1021 return false; 0
1022 } ----
1023 ----
1024 return true; 0
1025 }; 0
1026 ----
1027 MachineOperand Op1 = MI.getOperand(1); 0
1028 MachineOperand Op2 = MI.getOperand(2); 0
1029 if (isSingleUsePHI(&Op2) && dominatesAllSingleUseLIs(&Op1, &Op2)) 0
1030 std::swap(Op1, Op2); 0
1031 else if (!isSingleUsePHI(&Op1) || !dominatesAllSingleUseLIs(&Op2, &Op1)) 0
1032 break; // We don't have an ADD fed by LI's that can be transformed 0
1033 ----
1034 // Now we know that Op1 is the PHI node and Op2 is the dominator ----
1035 Register DominatorReg = Op2.getReg(); 0
1036 ----
1037 const TargetRegisterClass *TRC = MI.getOpcode() == PPC::ADD8 0
1038 ? &PPC::G8RC_and_G8RC_NOX0RegClass 0
1039 : &PPC::GPRC_and_GPRC_NOR0RegClass; 0
1040 MRI->setRegClass(DominatorReg, TRC); 0
1041 ----
1042 // replace LIs with ADDIs ----
1043 MachineInstr *DefPhiMI = getVRegDefOrNull(&Op1, MRI); 0
1044 for (unsigned i = 1; i < DefPhiMI->getNumOperands(); i += 2) { 0
1045 MachineInstr *LiMI = getVRegDefOrNull(&DefPhiMI->getOperand(i), MRI); 0
1046 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimizing LI to ADDI: "); 0
1047 LLVM_DEBUG(LiMI->dump()); 0
1048 ----
1049 // There could be repeated registers in the PHI, e.g: %1 = ----
1050 // PHI %6, <%bb.2>, %8, <%bb.3>, %8, <%bb.6>; So if we've ----
1051 // already replaced the def instruction, skip. ----
1052 if (LiMI->getOpcode() == PPC::ADDI || LiMI->getOpcode() == PPC::ADDI8) 0
1053 continue; 0
1054 ----
1055 assert((LiMI->getOpcode() == PPC::LI || 0
1056 LiMI->getOpcode() == PPC::LI8) && ----
1057 "Invalid Opcode!"); ----
1058 auto LiImm = LiMI->getOperand(1).getImm(); // save the imm of LI 0
1059 LiMI->removeOperand(1); // remove the imm of LI 0
1060 LiMI->setDesc(TII->get(LiMI->getOpcode() == PPC::LI ? PPC::ADDI 0
1061 : PPC::ADDI8)); ----
1062 MachineInstrBuilder(*LiMI->getParent()->getParent(), *LiMI) 0
1063 .addReg(DominatorReg) 0
1064 .addImm(LiImm); // restore the imm of LI 0
1065 LLVM_DEBUG(LiMI->dump()); 0
1066 } ----
1067 ----
1068 // Replace ADD with COPY ----
1069 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimizing ADD to COPY: "); 0
1070 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
1071 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::COPY), 0
1072 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
1073 .add(Op1); 0
1074 ToErase = &MI; 0
1075 Simplified = true; 0
1076 NumOptADDLIs++; 0
1077 break; 0
1078 } ----
1079 case PPC::RLDICR: { 0
1080 Simplified |= emitRLDICWhenLoweringJumpTables(MI) || 0
1081 combineSEXTAndSHL(MI, ToErase); 0
1082 break; 0
1083 } ----
1084 case PPC::RLWINM: 0
1085 case PPC::RLWINM_rec: ----
1086 case PPC::RLWINM8: ----
1087 case PPC::RLWINM8_rec: { ----
1088 Simplified = TII->combineRLWINM(MI, &ToErase); 0
1089 if (Simplified) 0
1090 ++NumRotatesCollapsed; 0
1091 break; 0
1092 } ----
1093 // We will replace TD/TW/TDI/TWI with an unconditional trap if it will ----
1094 // always trap, we will delete the node if it will never trap. ----
1095 case PPC::TDI: 0
1096 case PPC::TWI: ----
1097 case PPC::TD: ----
1098 case PPC::TW: { ----
1099 if (!EnableTrapOptimization) break; 0
1100 MachineInstr *LiMI1 = getVRegDefOrNull(&MI.getOperand(1), MRI); 0
1101 MachineInstr *LiMI2 = getVRegDefOrNull(&MI.getOperand(2), MRI); 0
1102 bool IsOperand2Immediate = MI.getOperand(2).isImm(); 0
1103 // We can only do the optimization if we can get immediates ----
1104 // from both operands ----
1105 if (!(LiMI1 && (LiMI1->getOpcode() == PPC::LI || 0
1106 LiMI1->getOpcode() == PPC::LI8))) 0
1107 break; 0
1108 if (!IsOperand2Immediate && 0
1109 !(LiMI2 && (LiMI2->getOpcode() == PPC::LI || 0
1110 LiMI2->getOpcode() == PPC::LI8))) 0
1111 break; 0
1112 ----
1113 auto ImmOperand0 = MI.getOperand(0).getImm(); 0
1114 auto ImmOperand1 = LiMI1->getOperand(1).getImm(); 0
1115 auto ImmOperand2 = IsOperand2Immediate ? MI.getOperand(2).getImm() 0
1116 : LiMI2->getOperand(1).getImm(); 0
1117 ----
1118 // We will replace the MI with an unconditional trap if it will always ----
1119 // trap. ----
1120 if ((ImmOperand0 == 31) || 0
1121 ((ImmOperand0 & 0x10) && 0
1122 ((int64_t)ImmOperand1 < (int64_t)ImmOperand2)) || 0
1123 ((ImmOperand0 & 0x8) && 0
1124 ((int64_t)ImmOperand1 > (int64_t)ImmOperand2)) || 0
1125 ((ImmOperand0 & 0x2) && 0
1126 ((uint64_t)ImmOperand1 < (uint64_t)ImmOperand2)) || 0
1127 ((ImmOperand0 & 0x1) && 0
1128 ((uint64_t)ImmOperand1 > (uint64_t)ImmOperand2)) || 0
1129 ((ImmOperand0 & 0x4) && (ImmOperand1 == ImmOperand2))) { 0
1130 BuildMI(MBB, &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), TII->get(PPC::TRAP)); 0
1131 TrapOpt = true; 0
1132 } ----
1133 // We will delete the MI if it will never trap. ----
1134 ToErase = &MI; 0
1135 Simplified = true; 0
1136 break; 0
1137 } ----
1138 } ----
1139 } ----
1140 ----
1141 // If the last instruction was marked for elimination, ----
1142 // remove it now. ----
1143 if (ToErase) { 0
1144 ToErase->eraseFromParent(); 0
1145 ToErase = nullptr; 0
1146 } ----
1147 // Reset TrapOpt to false at the end of the basic block. ----
1148 if (EnableTrapOptimization) 0
1149 TrapOpt = false; 0
1150 } ----
1151 ----
1152 // Eliminate all the TOC save instructions which are redundant. ----
1153 Simplified |= eliminateRedundantTOCSaves(TOCSaves); 0
1154 PPCFunctionInfo *FI = MF->getInfo(); 0
1155 if (FI->mustSaveTOC()) 0
1156 NumTOCSavesInPrologue++; 0
1157 ----
1158 // We try to eliminate redundant compare instruction. ----
1159 Simplified |= eliminateRedundantCompare(); 0
1160 ----
1161 return Simplified; 0
1162 } 0
1163 ----
1164 // helper functions for eliminateRedundantCompare ----
1165 static bool isEqOrNe(MachineInstr *BI) { 0
1166 PPC::Predicate Pred = (PPC::Predicate)BI->getOperand(0).getImm(); 0
1167 unsigned PredCond = PPC::getPredicateCondition(Pred); 0
1168 return (PredCond == PPC::PRED_EQ || PredCond == PPC::PRED_NE); 0
1169 } ----
1170 ----
1171 static bool isSupportedCmpOp(unsigned opCode) { 0
1172 return (opCode == PPC::CMPLD || opCode == PPC::CMPD || 0
1173 opCode == PPC::CMPLW || opCode == PPC::CMPW || 0
1174 opCode == PPC::CMPLDI || opCode == PPC::CMPDI || 0
1175 opCode == PPC::CMPLWI || opCode == PPC::CMPWI); 0
1176 } ----
1177 ----
1178 static bool is64bitCmpOp(unsigned opCode) { 0
1179 return (opCode == PPC::CMPLD || opCode == PPC::CMPD || 0
1180 opCode == PPC::CMPLDI || opCode == PPC::CMPDI); 0
1181 } ----
1182 ----
1183 static bool isSignedCmpOp(unsigned opCode) { 0
1184 return (opCode == PPC::CMPD || opCode == PPC::CMPW || 0
1185 opCode == PPC::CMPDI || opCode == PPC::CMPWI); 0
1186 } ----
1187 ----
1188 static unsigned getSignedCmpOpCode(unsigned opCode) { 0
1189 if (opCode == PPC::CMPLD) return PPC::CMPD; 0
1190 if (opCode == PPC::CMPLW) return PPC::CMPW; 0
1191 if (opCode == PPC::CMPLDI) return PPC::CMPDI; 0
1192 if (opCode == PPC::CMPLWI) return PPC::CMPWI; 0
1193 return opCode; 0
1194 } ----
1195 ----
1196 // We can decrement immediate x in (GE x) by changing it to (GT x-1) or ----
1197 // (LT x) to (LE x-1) ----
1198 static unsigned getPredicateToDecImm(MachineInstr *BI, MachineInstr *CMPI) { 0
1199 uint64_t Imm = CMPI->getOperand(2).getImm(); 0
1200 bool SignedCmp = isSignedCmpOp(CMPI->getOpcode()); 0
1201 if ((!SignedCmp && Imm == 0) || (SignedCmp && Imm == 0x8000)) 0
1202 return 0; 0
1203 ----
1204 PPC::Predicate Pred = (PPC::Predicate)BI->getOperand(0).getImm(); 0
1205 unsigned PredCond = PPC::getPredicateCondition(Pred); 0
1206 unsigned PredHint = PPC::getPredicateHint(Pred); 0
1207 if (PredCond == PPC::PRED_GE) 0
1208 return PPC::getPredicate(PPC::PRED_GT, PredHint); 0
1209 if (PredCond == PPC::PRED_LT) 0
1210 return PPC::getPredicate(PPC::PRED_LE, PredHint); 0
1211 ----
1212 return 0; 0
1213 } ----
1214 ----
1215 // We can increment immediate x in (GT x) by changing it to (GE x+1) or ----
1216 // (LE x) to (LT x+1) ----
1217 static unsigned getPredicateToIncImm(MachineInstr *BI, MachineInstr *CMPI) { 0
1218 uint64_t Imm = CMPI->getOperand(2).getImm(); 0
1219 bool SignedCmp = isSignedCmpOp(CMPI->getOpcode()); 0
1220 if ((!SignedCmp && Imm == 0xFFFF) || (SignedCmp && Imm == 0x7FFF)) 0
1221 return 0; 0
1222 ----
1223 PPC::Predicate Pred = (PPC::Predicate)BI->getOperand(0).getImm(); 0
1224 unsigned PredCond = PPC::getPredicateCondition(Pred); 0
1225 unsigned PredHint = PPC::getPredicateHint(Pred); 0
1226 if (PredCond == PPC::PRED_GT) 0
1227 return PPC::getPredicate(PPC::PRED_GE, PredHint); 0
1228 if (PredCond == PPC::PRED_LE) 0
1229 return PPC::getPredicate(PPC::PRED_LT, PredHint); 0
1230 ----
1231 return 0; 0
1232 } ----
1233 ----
1234 // This takes a Phi node and returns a register value for the specified BB. ----
1235 static unsigned getIncomingRegForBlock(MachineInstr *Phi, 0
1236 MachineBasicBlock *MBB) { ----
1237 for (unsigned I = 2, E = Phi->getNumOperands() + 1; I != E; I += 2) { 0
1238 MachineOperand &MO = Phi->getOperand(I); 0
1239 if (MO.getMBB() == MBB) 0
1240 return Phi->getOperand(I-1).getReg(); 0
1241 } ----
1242 llvm_unreachable("invalid src basic block for this Phi node\n"); 0
1243 return 0; ----
1244 } ----
1245 ----
1246 // This function tracks the source of the register through register copy. ----
1247 // If BB1 and BB2 are non-NULL, we also track PHI instruction in BB2 ----
1248 // assuming that the control comes from BB1 into BB2. ----
1249 static unsigned getSrcVReg(unsigned Reg, MachineBasicBlock *BB1, 0
1250 MachineBasicBlock *BB2, MachineRegisterInfo *MRI) { ----
1251 unsigned SrcReg = Reg; 0
1252 while (true) { ----
1253 unsigned NextReg = SrcReg; 0
1254 MachineInstr *Inst = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcReg); 0
1255 if (BB1 && Inst->getOpcode() == PPC::PHI && Inst->getParent() == BB2) { 0
1256 NextReg = getIncomingRegForBlock(Inst, BB1); 0
1257 // We track through PHI only once to avoid infinite loop. ----
1258 BB1 = nullptr; 0
1259 } ----
1260 else if (Inst->isFullCopy()) 0
1261 NextReg = Inst->getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
1262 if (NextReg == SrcReg || !Register::isVirtualRegister(NextReg)) 0
1263 break; 0
1264 SrcReg = NextReg; 0
1265 } 0
1266 return SrcReg; 0
1267 } ----
1268 ----
1269 static bool eligibleForCompareElimination(MachineBasicBlock &MBB, 0
1270 MachineBasicBlock *&PredMBB, ----
1271 MachineBasicBlock *&MBBtoMoveCmp, ----
1272 MachineRegisterInfo *MRI) { ----
1273 ----
1274 auto isEligibleBB = [&](MachineBasicBlock &BB) { 0
1275 auto BII = BB.getFirstInstrTerminator(); 0
1276 // We optimize BBs ending with a conditional branch. ----
1277 // We check only for BCC here, not BCCLR, because BCCLR ----
1278 // will be formed only later in the pipeline. ----
1279 if (BB.succ_size() == 2 && 0
1280 BII != BB.instr_end() && 0
1281 (*BII).getOpcode() == PPC::BCC && 0
1282 (*BII).getOperand(1).isReg()) { 0
1283 // We optimize only if the condition code is used only by one BCC. ----
1284 Register CndReg = (*BII).getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
1285 if (!CndReg.isVirtual() || !MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(CndReg)) 0
1286 return false; 0
1287 ----
1288 MachineInstr *CMPI = MRI->getVRegDef(CndReg); 0
1289 // We assume compare and branch are in the same BB for ease of analysis. ----
1290 if (CMPI->getParent() != &BB) 0
1291 return false; 0
1292 ----
1293 // We skip this BB if a physical register is used in comparison. ----
1294 for (MachineOperand &MO : CMPI->operands()) 0
1295 if (MO.isReg() && !MO.getReg().isVirtual()) 0
1296 return false; 0
1297 ----
1298 return true; 0
1299 } ----
1300 return false; 0
1301 }; 0
1302 ----
1303 // If this BB has more than one successor, we can create a new BB and ----
1304 // move the compare instruction in the new BB. ----
1305 // So far, we do not move compare instruction to a BB having multiple ----
1306 // successors to avoid potentially increasing code size. ----
1307 auto isEligibleForMoveCmp = [](MachineBasicBlock &BB) { 0
1308 return BB.succ_size() == 1; 0
1309 }; ----
1310 ----
1311 if (!isEligibleBB(MBB)) 0
1312 return false; 0
1313 ----
1314 unsigned NumPredBBs = MBB.pred_size(); 0
1315 if (NumPredBBs == 1) { 0
1316 MachineBasicBlock *TmpMBB = *MBB.pred_begin(); 0
1317 if (isEligibleBB(*TmpMBB)) { 0
1318 PredMBB = TmpMBB; 0
1319 MBBtoMoveCmp = nullptr; 0
1320 return true; 0
1321 } ----
1322 } ----
1323 else if (NumPredBBs == 2) { 0
1324 // We check for partially redundant case. ----
1325 // So far, we support cases with only two predecessors ----
1326 // to avoid increasing the number of instructions. ----
1327 MachineBasicBlock::pred_iterator PI = MBB.pred_begin(); 0
1328 MachineBasicBlock *Pred1MBB = *PI; 0
1329 MachineBasicBlock *Pred2MBB = *(PI+1); 0
1330 ----
1331 if (isEligibleBB(*Pred1MBB) && isEligibleForMoveCmp(*Pred2MBB)) { 0
1332 // We assume Pred1MBB is the BB containing the compare to be merged and ----
1333 // Pred2MBB is the BB to which we will append a compare instruction. ----
1334 // Proceed as is if Pred1MBB is different from MBB. ----
1335 } ----
1336 else if (isEligibleBB(*Pred2MBB) && isEligibleForMoveCmp(*Pred1MBB)) { 0
1337 // We need to swap Pred1MBB and Pred2MBB to canonicalize. ----
1338 std::swap(Pred1MBB, Pred2MBB); 0
1339 } ----
1340 else return false; 0
1341 ----
1342 if (Pred1MBB == &MBB) 0
1343 return false; 0
1344 ----
1345 // Here, Pred2MBB is the BB to which we need to append a compare inst. ----
1346 // We cannot move the compare instruction if operands are not available ----
1347 // in Pred2MBB (i.e. defined in MBB by an instruction other than PHI). ----
1348 MachineInstr *BI = &*MBB.getFirstInstrTerminator(); 0
1349 MachineInstr *CMPI = MRI->getVRegDef(BI->getOperand(1).getReg()); 0
1350 for (int I = 1; I <= 2; I++) 0
1351 if (CMPI->getOperand(I).isReg()) { 0
1352 MachineInstr *Inst = MRI->getVRegDef(CMPI->getOperand(I).getReg()); 0
1353 if (Inst->getParent() == &MBB && Inst->getOpcode() != PPC::PHI) 0
1354 return false; 0
1355 } ----
1356 ----
1357 PredMBB = Pred1MBB; 0
1358 MBBtoMoveCmp = Pred2MBB; 0
1359 return true; 0
1360 } ----
1361 ----
1362 return false; 0
1363 } ----
1364 ----
1365 // This function will iterate over the input map containing a pair of TOC save ----
1366 // instruction and a flag. The flag will be set to false if the TOC save is ----
1367 // proven redundant. This function will erase from the basic block all the TOC ----
1368 // saves marked as redundant. ----
1369 bool PPCMIPeephole::eliminateRedundantTOCSaves( 0
1370 std::map &TOCSaves) { ----
1371 bool Simplified = false; 0
1372 int NumKept = 0; 0
1373 for (auto TOCSave : TOCSaves) { 0
1374 if (!TOCSave.second) { 0
1375 TOCSave.first->eraseFromParent(); 0
1376 RemoveTOCSave++; 0
1377 Simplified = true; 0
1378 } else { ----
1379 NumKept++; 0
1380 } ----
1381 } ----
1382 ----
1383 if (NumKept > 1) 0
1384 MultiTOCSaves++; 0
1385 ----
1386 return Simplified; 0
1387 } ----
1388 ----
1389 // If multiple conditional branches are executed based on the (essentially) ----
1390 // same comparison, we merge compare instructions into one and make multiple ----
1391 // conditional branches on this comparison. ----
1392 // For example, ----
1393 // if (a == 0) { ... } ----
1394 // else if (a < 0) { ... } ----
1395 // can be executed by one compare and two conditional branches instead of ----
1396 // two pairs of a compare and a conditional branch. ----
1397 // ----
1398 // This method merges two compare instructions in two MBBs and modifies the ----
1399 // compare and conditional branch instructions if needed. ----
1400 // For the above example, the input for this pass looks like: ----
1401 // cmplwi r3, 0 ----
1402 // beq 0, .LBB0_3 ----
1403 // cmpwi r3, -1 ----
1404 // bgt 0, .LBB0_4 ----
1405 // So, before merging two compares, we need to modify these instructions as ----
1406 // cmpwi r3, 0 ; cmplwi and cmpwi yield same result for beq ----
1407 // beq 0, .LBB0_3 ----
1408 // cmpwi r3, 0 ; greather than -1 means greater or equal to 0 ----
1409 // bge 0, .LBB0_4 ----
1410 ----
1411 bool PPCMIPeephole::eliminateRedundantCompare() { 0
1412 bool Simplified = false; 0
1413 ----
1414 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB2 : *MF) { 0
1415 MachineBasicBlock *MBB1 = nullptr, *MBBtoMoveCmp = nullptr; 0
1416 ----
1417 // For fully redundant case, we select two basic blocks MBB1 and MBB2 ----
1418 // as an optimization target if ----
1419 // - both MBBs end with a conditional branch, ----
1420 // - MBB1 is the only predecessor of MBB2, and ----
1421 // - compare does not take a physical register as a operand in both MBBs. ----
1422 // In this case, eligibleForCompareElimination sets MBBtoMoveCmp nullptr. ----
1423 // ----
1424 // As partially redundant case, we additionally handle if MBB2 has one ----
1425 // additional predecessor, which has only one successor (MBB2). ----
1426 // In this case, we move the compare instruction originally in MBB2 into ----
1427 // MBBtoMoveCmp. This partially redundant case is typically appear by ----
1428 // compiling a while loop; here, MBBtoMoveCmp is the loop preheader. ----
1429 // ----
1430 // Overview of CFG of related basic blocks ----
1431 // Fully redundant case Partially redundant case ----
1432 // -------- ---------------- -------- ----
1433 // | MBB1 | (w/ 2 succ) | MBBtoMoveCmp | | MBB1 | (w/ 2 succ) ----
1434 // -------- ---------------- -------- ----
1435 // | \ (w/ 1 succ) \ | \ ----
1436 // | \ \ | \ ----
1437 // | \ | ----
1438 // -------- -------- ----
1439 // | MBB2 | (w/ 1 pred | MBB2 | (w/ 2 pred ----
1440 // -------- and 2 succ) -------- and 2 succ) ----
1441 // | \ | \ ----
1442 // | \ | \ ----
1443 // ----
1444 if (!eligibleForCompareElimination(MBB2, MBB1, MBBtoMoveCmp, MRI)) 0
1445 continue; 0
1446 ----
1447 MachineInstr *BI1 = &*MBB1->getFirstInstrTerminator(); 0
1448 MachineInstr *CMPI1 = MRI->getVRegDef(BI1->getOperand(1).getReg()); 0
1449 ----
1450 MachineInstr *BI2 = &*MBB2.getFirstInstrTerminator(); 0
1451 MachineInstr *CMPI2 = MRI->getVRegDef(BI2->getOperand(1).getReg()); 0
1452 bool IsPartiallyRedundant = (MBBtoMoveCmp != nullptr); 0
1453 ----
1454 // We cannot optimize an unsupported compare opcode or ----
1455 // a mix of 32-bit and 64-bit comparisons ----
1456 if (!isSupportedCmpOp(CMPI1->getOpcode()) || 0
1457 !isSupportedCmpOp(CMPI2->getOpcode()) || 0
1458 is64bitCmpOp(CMPI1->getOpcode()) != is64bitCmpOp(CMPI2->getOpcode())) 0
1459 continue; 0
1460 ----
1461 unsigned NewOpCode = 0; 0
1462 unsigned NewPredicate1 = 0, NewPredicate2 = 0; 0
1463 int16_t Imm1 = 0, NewImm1 = 0, Imm2 = 0, NewImm2 = 0; 0
1464 bool SwapOperands = false; 0
1465 ----
1466 if (CMPI1->getOpcode() != CMPI2->getOpcode()) { 0
1467 // Typically, unsigned comparison is used for equality check, but ----
1468 // we replace it with a signed comparison if the comparison ----
1469 // to be merged is a signed comparison. ----
1470 // In other cases of opcode mismatch, we cannot optimize this. ----
1471 ----
1472 // We cannot change opcode when comparing against an immediate ----
1473 // if the most significant bit of the immediate is one ----
1474 // due to the difference in sign extension. ----
1475 auto CmpAgainstImmWithSignBit = [](MachineInstr *I) { 0
1476 if (!I->getOperand(2).isImm()) 0
1477 return false; 0
1478 int16_t Imm = (int16_t)I->getOperand(2).getImm(); 0
1479 return Imm < 0; 0
1480 }; ----
1481 ----
1482 if (isEqOrNe(BI2) && !CmpAgainstImmWithSignBit(CMPI2) && 0
1483 CMPI1->getOpcode() == getSignedCmpOpCode(CMPI2->getOpcode())) 0
1484 NewOpCode = CMPI1->getOpcode(); 0
1485 else if (isEqOrNe(BI1) && !CmpAgainstImmWithSignBit(CMPI1) && 0
1486 getSignedCmpOpCode(CMPI1->getOpcode()) == CMPI2->getOpcode()) 0
1487 NewOpCode = CMPI2->getOpcode(); 0
1488 else continue; 0
1489 } ----
1490 ----
1491 if (CMPI1->getOperand(2).isReg() && CMPI2->getOperand(2).isReg()) { 0
1492 // In case of comparisons between two registers, these two registers ----
1493 // must be same to merge two comparisons. ----
1494 unsigned Cmp1Operand1 = getSrcVReg(CMPI1->getOperand(1).getReg(), 0
1495 nullptr, nullptr, MRI); ----
1496 unsigned Cmp1Operand2 = getSrcVReg(CMPI1->getOperand(2).getReg(), 0
1497 nullptr, nullptr, MRI); ----
1498 unsigned Cmp2Operand1 = getSrcVReg(CMPI2->getOperand(1).getReg(), 0
1499 MBB1, &MBB2, MRI); ----
1500 unsigned Cmp2Operand2 = getSrcVReg(CMPI2->getOperand(2).getReg(), 0
1501 MBB1, &MBB2, MRI); ----
1502 ----
1503 if (Cmp1Operand1 == Cmp2Operand1 && Cmp1Operand2 == Cmp2Operand2) { 0
1504 // Same pair of registers in the same order; ready to merge as is. ----
1505 } ----
1506 else if (Cmp1Operand1 == Cmp2Operand2 && Cmp1Operand2 == Cmp2Operand1) { 0
1507 // Same pair of registers in different order. ----
1508 // We reverse the predicate to merge compare instructions. ----
1509 PPC::Predicate Pred = (PPC::Predicate)BI2->getOperand(0).getImm(); 0
1510 NewPredicate2 = (unsigned)PPC::getSwappedPredicate(Pred); 0
1511 // In case of partial redundancy, we need to swap operands ----
1512 // in another compare instruction. ----
1513 SwapOperands = true; 0
1514 } 0
1515 else continue; 0
1516 } ----
1517 else if (CMPI1->getOperand(2).isImm() && CMPI2->getOperand(2).isImm()) { 0
1518 // In case of comparisons between a register and an immediate, ----
1519 // the operand register must be same for two compare instructions. ----
1520 unsigned Cmp1Operand1 = getSrcVReg(CMPI1->getOperand(1).getReg(), 0
1521 nullptr, nullptr, MRI); ----
1522 unsigned Cmp2Operand1 = getSrcVReg(CMPI2->getOperand(1).getReg(), 0
1523 MBB1, &MBB2, MRI); ----
1524 if (Cmp1Operand1 != Cmp2Operand1) 0
1525 continue; 0
1526 ----
1527 NewImm1 = Imm1 = (int16_t)CMPI1->getOperand(2).getImm(); 0
1528 NewImm2 = Imm2 = (int16_t)CMPI2->getOperand(2).getImm(); 0
1529 ----
1530 // If immediate are not same, we try to adjust by changing predicate; ----
1531 // e.g. GT imm means GE (imm+1). ----
1532 if (Imm1 != Imm2 && (!isEqOrNe(BI2) || !isEqOrNe(BI1))) { 0
1533 int Diff = Imm1 - Imm2; 0
1534 if (Diff < -2 || Diff > 2) 0
1535 continue; 0
1536 ----
1537 unsigned PredToInc1 = getPredicateToIncImm(BI1, CMPI1); 0
1538 unsigned PredToDec1 = getPredicateToDecImm(BI1, CMPI1); 0
1539 unsigned PredToInc2 = getPredicateToIncImm(BI2, CMPI2); 0
1540 unsigned PredToDec2 = getPredicateToDecImm(BI2, CMPI2); 0
1541 if (Diff == 2) { 0
1542 if (PredToInc2 && PredToDec1) { 0
1543 NewPredicate2 = PredToInc2; 0
1544 NewPredicate1 = PredToDec1; 0
1545 NewImm2++; 0
1546 NewImm1--; 0
1547 } ----
1548 } ----
1549 else if (Diff == 1) { 0
1550 if (PredToInc2) { 0
1551 NewImm2++; 0
1552 NewPredicate2 = PredToInc2; 0
1553 } ----
1554 else if (PredToDec1) { 0
1555 NewImm1--; 0
1556 NewPredicate1 = PredToDec1; 0
1557 } ----
1558 } ----
1559 else if (Diff == -1) { 0
1560 if (PredToDec2) { 0
1561 NewImm2--; 0
1562 NewPredicate2 = PredToDec2; 0
1563 } ----
1564 else if (PredToInc1) { 0
1565 NewImm1++; 0
1566 NewPredicate1 = PredToInc1; 0
1567 } ----
1568 } ----
1569 else if (Diff == -2) { 0
1570 if (PredToDec2 && PredToInc1) { 0
1571 NewPredicate2 = PredToDec2; 0
1572 NewPredicate1 = PredToInc1; 0
1573 NewImm2--; 0
1574 NewImm1++; 0
1575 } ----
1576 } ----
1577 } ----
1578 ----
1579 // We cannot merge two compares if the immediates are not same. ----
1580 if (NewImm2 != NewImm1) 0
1581 continue; 0
1582 } ----
1583 ----
1584 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Optimize two pairs of compare and branch:\n"); 0
1585 LLVM_DEBUG(CMPI1->dump()); 0
1586 LLVM_DEBUG(BI1->dump()); 0
1587 LLVM_DEBUG(CMPI2->dump()); 0
1588 LLVM_DEBUG(BI2->dump()); 0
1589 ----
1590 // We adjust opcode, predicates and immediate as we determined above. ----
1591 if (NewOpCode != 0 && NewOpCode != CMPI1->getOpcode()) { 0
1592 CMPI1->setDesc(TII->get(NewOpCode)); 0
1593 } ----
1594 if (NewPredicate1) { 0
1595 BI1->getOperand(0).setImm(NewPredicate1); 0
1596 } ----
1597 if (NewPredicate2) { 0
1598 BI2->getOperand(0).setImm(NewPredicate2); 0
1599 } ----
1600 if (NewImm1 != Imm1) { 0
1601 CMPI1->getOperand(2).setImm(NewImm1); 0
1602 } ----
1603 ----
1604 if (IsPartiallyRedundant) { 0
1605 // We touch up the compare instruction in MBB2 and move it to ----
1606 // a previous BB to handle partially redundant case. ----
1607 if (SwapOperands) { 0
1608 Register Op1 = CMPI2->getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
1609 Register Op2 = CMPI2->getOperand(2).getReg(); 0
1610 CMPI2->getOperand(1).setReg(Op2); 0
1611 CMPI2->getOperand(2).setReg(Op1); 0
1612 } ----
1613 if (NewImm2 != Imm2) 0
1614 CMPI2->getOperand(2).setImm(NewImm2); 0
1615 ----
1616 for (int I = 1; I <= 2; I++) { 0
1617 if (CMPI2->getOperand(I).isReg()) { 0
1618 MachineInstr *Inst = MRI->getVRegDef(CMPI2->getOperand(I).getReg()); 0
1619 if (Inst->getParent() != &MBB2) 0
1620 continue; 0
1621 ----
1622 assert(Inst->getOpcode() == PPC::PHI && 0
1623 "We cannot support if an operand comes from this BB."); ----
1624 unsigned SrcReg = getIncomingRegForBlock(Inst, MBBtoMoveCmp); 0
1625 CMPI2->getOperand(I).setReg(SrcReg); 0
1626 } ----
1627 } ----
1628 auto I = MachineBasicBlock::iterator(MBBtoMoveCmp->getFirstTerminator()); 0
1629 MBBtoMoveCmp->splice(I, &MBB2, MachineBasicBlock::iterator(CMPI2)); 0
1630 ----
1631 DebugLoc DL = CMPI2->getDebugLoc(); 0
1632 Register NewVReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::CRRCRegClass); 0
1633 BuildMI(MBB2, MBB2.begin(), DL, 0
1634 TII->get(PPC::PHI), NewVReg) 0
1635 .addReg(BI1->getOperand(1).getReg()).addMBB(MBB1) 0
1636 .addReg(BI2->getOperand(1).getReg()).addMBB(MBBtoMoveCmp); 0
1637 BI2->getOperand(1).setReg(NewVReg); 0
1638 } 0
1639 else { ----
1640 // We finally eliminate compare instruction in MBB2. ----
1641 BI2->getOperand(1).setReg(BI1->getOperand(1).getReg()); 0
1642 CMPI2->eraseFromParent(); 0
1643 } ----
1644 BI2->getOperand(1).setIsKill(true); 0
1645 BI1->getOperand(1).setIsKill(false); 0
1646 ----
1647 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "into a compare and two branches:\n"); 0
1648 LLVM_DEBUG(CMPI1->dump()); 0
1649 LLVM_DEBUG(BI1->dump()); 0
1650 LLVM_DEBUG(BI2->dump()); 0
1651 if (IsPartiallyRedundant) { 0
1652 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "The following compare is moved into " 0
1653 << printMBBReference(*MBBtoMoveCmp) ----
1654 << " to handle partial redundancy.\n"); ----
1655 LLVM_DEBUG(CMPI2->dump()); 0
1656 } ----
1657 ----
1658 Simplified = true; 0
1659 } ----
1660 ----
1661 return Simplified; 0
1662 } ----
1663 ----
1664 // We miss the opportunity to emit an RLDIC when lowering jump tables ----
1665 // since ISEL sees only a single basic block. When selecting, the clear ----
1666 // and shift left will be in different blocks. ----
1667 bool PPCMIPeephole::emitRLDICWhenLoweringJumpTables(MachineInstr &MI) { 0
1668 if (MI.getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICR) 0
1669 return false; 0
1670 ----
1671 Register SrcReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
1672 if (!SrcReg.isVirtual()) 0
1673 return false; 0
1674 ----
1675 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcReg); 0
1676 if (SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICL) 0
1677 return false; 0
1678 ----
1679 MachineOperand MOpSHSrc = SrcMI->getOperand(2); 0
1680 MachineOperand MOpMBSrc = SrcMI->getOperand(3); 0
1681 MachineOperand MOpSHMI = MI.getOperand(2); 0
1682 MachineOperand MOpMEMI = MI.getOperand(3); 0
1683 if (!(MOpSHSrc.isImm() && MOpMBSrc.isImm() && MOpSHMI.isImm() && 0
1684 MOpMEMI.isImm())) 0
1685 return false; 0
1686 ----
1687 uint64_t SHSrc = MOpSHSrc.getImm(); 0
1688 uint64_t MBSrc = MOpMBSrc.getImm(); 0
1689 uint64_t SHMI = MOpSHMI.getImm(); 0
1690 uint64_t MEMI = MOpMEMI.getImm(); 0
1691 uint64_t NewSH = SHSrc + SHMI; 0
1692 uint64_t NewMB = MBSrc - SHMI; 0
1693 if (NewMB > 63 || NewSH > 63) 0
1694 return false; 0
1695 ----
1696 // The bits cleared with RLDICL are [0, MBSrc). ----
1697 // The bits cleared with RLDICR are (MEMI, 63]. ----
1698 // After the sequence, the bits cleared are: ----
1699 // [0, MBSrc-SHMI) and (MEMI, 63). ----
1700 // ----
1701 // The bits cleared with RLDIC are [0, NewMB) and (63-NewSH, 63]. ----
1702 if ((63 - NewSH) != MEMI) 0
1703 return false; 0
1704 ----
1705 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converting pair: "); 0
1706 LLVM_DEBUG(SrcMI->dump()); 0
1707 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
1708 ----
1709 MI.setDesc(TII->get(PPC::RLDIC)); 0
1710 MI.getOperand(1).setReg(SrcMI->getOperand(1).getReg()); 0
1711 MI.getOperand(2).setImm(NewSH); 0
1712 MI.getOperand(3).setImm(NewMB); 0
1713 MI.getOperand(1).setIsKill(SrcMI->getOperand(1).isKill()); 0
1714 SrcMI->getOperand(1).setIsKill(false); 0
1715 ----
1716 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "To: "); 0
1717 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
1718 NumRotatesCollapsed++; 0
1719 // If SrcReg has no non-debug use it's safe to delete its def SrcMI. ----
1720 if (MRI->use_nodbg_empty(SrcReg)) { 0
1721 assert(!SrcMI->hasImplicitDef() && 0
1722 "Not expecting an implicit def with this instr."); ----
1723 SrcMI->eraseFromParent(); 0
1724 } ----
1725 return true; 0
1726 } ----
1727 ----
1728 // For case in LLVM IR ----
1729 // entry: ----
1730 // %iconv = sext i32 %index to i64 ----
1731 // br i1 undef label %true, label %false ----
1732 // true: ----
1733 // %ptr = getelementptr inbounds i32, i32* null, i64 %iconv ----
1734 // ... ----
1735 // PPCISelLowering::combineSHL fails to combine, because sext and shl are in ----
1736 // different BBs when conducting instruction selection. We can do a peephole ----
1737 // optimization to combine these two instructions into extswsli after ----
1738 // instruction selection. ----
1739 bool PPCMIPeephole::combineSEXTAndSHL(MachineInstr &MI, 0
1740 MachineInstr *&ToErase) { ----
1741 if (MI.getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICR) 0
1742 return false; 0
1743 ----
1744 if (!MF->getSubtarget().isISA3_0()) 0
1745 return false; 0
1746 ----
1747 assert(MI.getNumOperands() == 4 && "RLDICR should have 4 operands"); 0
1748 ----
1749 MachineOperand MOpSHMI = MI.getOperand(2); 0
1750 MachineOperand MOpMEMI = MI.getOperand(3); 0
1751 if (!(MOpSHMI.isImm() && MOpMEMI.isImm())) 0
1752 return false; 0
1753 ----
1754 uint64_t SHMI = MOpSHMI.getImm(); 0
1755 uint64_t MEMI = MOpMEMI.getImm(); 0
1756 if (SHMI + MEMI != 63) 0
1757 return false; 0
1758 ----
1759 Register SrcReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg(); 0
1760 if (!SrcReg.isVirtual()) 0
1761 return false; 0
1762 ----
1763 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcReg); 0
1764 if (SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::EXTSW && 0
1765 SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::EXTSW_32_64) 0
1766 return false; 0
1767 ----
1768 // If the register defined by extsw has more than one use, combination is not ----
1769 // needed. ----
1770 if (!MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(SrcReg)) 0
1771 return false; 0
1772 ----
1773 assert(SrcMI->getNumOperands() == 2 && "EXTSW should have 2 operands"); 0
1774 assert(SrcMI->getOperand(1).isReg() && 0
1775 "EXTSW's second operand should be a register"); ----
1776 if (!SrcMI->getOperand(1).getReg().isVirtual()) 0
1777 return false; 0
1778 ----
1779 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Combining pair: "); 0
1780 LLVM_DEBUG(SrcMI->dump()); 0
1781 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 0
1782 ----
1783 MachineInstr *NewInstr = ----
1784 BuildMI(*MI.getParent(), &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), 0
1785 SrcMI->getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSW ? TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI) 0
1786 : TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI_32_64), 0
1787 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
1788 .add(SrcMI->getOperand(1)) 0
1789 .add(MOpSHMI); 0
1790 (void)NewInstr; ----
1791 ----
1792 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "TO: "); 0
1793 LLVM_DEBUG(NewInstr->dump()); 0
1794 ++NumEXTSWAndSLDICombined; 0
1795 ToErase = &MI; 0
1796 // SrcMI, which is extsw, is of no use now, erase it. ----
1797 SrcMI->eraseFromParent(); 0
1798 return true; 0
1799 } ----
1800 ----
1801 } // end default namespace ----
1802 ----
1803 INITIALIZE_PASS_BEGIN(PPCMIPeephole, DEBUG_TYPE, 2 ../DebugInfoTest/example_mips_dbg.ll ../DebugInfoTest/example_mips.ll
1804 "PowerPC MI Peephole Optimization", false, false) ----
1805 INITIALIZE_PASS_DEPENDENCY(MachineBlockFrequencyInfo) 2 ../DebugInfoTest/example_mips_dbg.ll ../DebugInfoTest/example_mips.ll
1806 INITIALIZE_PASS_DEPENDENCY(MachineDominatorTree) 2 ../DebugInfoTest/example_mips_dbg.ll ../DebugInfoTest/example_mips.ll

1808 INITIALIZE_PASS_END(PPCMIPeephole, DEBUG_TYPE, 4 ../DebugInfoTest/example_mips_dbg.ll ../DebugInfoTest/example_mips.ll
1809 "PowerPC MI Peephole Optimization", false, false) ----

1811 char PPCMIPeephole::ID = 0; ----

8 // 8 //
9 // This pass performs peephole optimizations to clean up ugly code 9 // This pass performs peephole optimizations to clean up ugly code
10 // sequences at the MachineInstruction layer. It runs at the end of 10 // sequences at the MachineInstruction layer. It runs at the end of
11 // the SSA phases, following VSX swap removal. A pass of dead code 11 // the SSA phases, following VSX swap removal. A pass of dead code
12 // elimination follows this one for quick clean-up of any dead 12 // elimination follows this one for quick clean-up of any dead
13 // instructions introduced here. Although we could do this as callbacks 13 // instructions introduced here. Although we could do this as callbacks
14 // from the generic peephole pass, this would have a couple of bad 14 // from the generic peephole pass, this would have a couple of bad
15 // effects: it might remove optimization opportunities for VSX swap 15 // effects: it might remove optimization opportunities for VSX swap
16 // removal, and it would miss cleanups made possible following VSX 16 // removal, and it would miss cleanups made possible following VSX
17 // swap removal. 17 // swap removal.

133 // Main entry point for this pass. 133 // Main entry point for this pass.
134 bool runOnMachineFunction(MachineFunction &MF) override { 134 bool runOnMachineFunction(MachineFunction &MF) override {
135 initialize(MF); 135 initialize(MF);
136 // At this point, TOC pointer should not be used in a function that uses 136 // At this point, TOC pointer should not be used in a function that uses
137 // PC-Relative addressing. 137 // PC-Relative addressing.
138 assert((MF.getRegInfo().use_empty(PPC::X2) || 138 assert((MF.getRegInfo().use_empty(PPC::X2) ||
139 !MF.getSubtarget().isUsingPCRelativeCalls()) && 139 !MF.getSubtarget().isUsingPCRelativeCalls()) &&
140 "TOC pointer used in a function using PC-Relative addressing!"); 140 "TOC pointer used in a function using PC-Relative addressing!");
141 if (skipFunction(MF.getFunction())) 141 if (skipFunction(MF.getFunction()))
142 return false; 142 return false;
143 return simplifyCode(); 143 return simplifyCode();
144 } 144 }
145 }; 145 };

150 MRI = &MF->getRegInfo(); 150 MRI = &MF->getRegInfo();
151 MDT = &getAnalysis(); 151 MDT = &getAnalysis();
152 MPDT = &getAnalysis(); 152 MPDT = &getAnalysis();

154 EntryFreq = MBFI->getEntryFreq(); 154 EntryFreq = MBFI->getEntryFreq();

157 LLVM_DEBUG(MF->dump()); 157 LLVM_DEBUG(MF->dump());

160 static MachineInstr *getVRegDefOrNull(MachineOperand *Op, 160 static MachineInstr *getVRegDefOrNull(MachineOperand *Op,
161 MachineRegisterInfo *MRI) { 161 MachineRegisterInfo *MRI) {
162 assert(Op && "Invalid Operand!"); 162 assert(Op && "Invalid Operand!");

164 return nullptr; 164 return nullptr;
165 165
166 Register Reg = Op->getReg(); 166 Register Reg = Op->getReg();
167 if (!Reg.isVirtual()) 167 if (!Reg.isVirtual())
168 return nullptr; 168 return nullptr;
169 169
170 return MRI->getVRegDef(Reg); 170 return MRI->getVRegDef(Reg);
171 } 171 }
