173 // This function returns number of known zero bits in output of MI 173 // This function returns number of known zero bits in output of MI
174 // starting from the most significant bit. 174 // starting from the most significant bit.
175 static unsigned getKnownLeadingZeroCount(const unsigned Reg, 175 static unsigned getKnownLeadingZeroCount(const unsigned Reg,
176 const PPCInstrInfo *TII, 176 const PPCInstrInfo *TII,
177 const MachineRegisterInfo *MRI) { 177 const MachineRegisterInfo *MRI) {
178 MachineInstr *MI = MRI->getVRegDef(Reg); 178 MachineInstr *MI = MRI->getVRegDef(Reg);
179 unsigned Opcode = MI->getOpcode(); 179 unsigned Opcode = MI->getOpcode();
180 if (Opcode == PPC::RLDICL || Opcode == PPC::RLDICL_rec || 180 if (Opcode == PPC::RLDICL || Opcode == PPC::RLDICL_rec ||
181 Opcode == PPC::RLDCL || Opcode == PPC::RLDCL_rec) 181 Opcode == PPC::RLDCL || Opcode == PPC::RLDCL_rec)
182 return MI->getOperand(3).getImm(); 182 return MI->getOperand(3).getImm();
183 183
184 if ((Opcode == PPC::RLDIC || Opcode == PPC::RLDIC_rec) && 184 if ((Opcode == PPC::RLDIC || Opcode == PPC::RLDIC_rec) &&
185 MI->getOperand(3).getImm() <= 63 - MI->getOperand(2).getImm()) 185 MI->getOperand(3).getImm() <= 63 - MI->getOperand(2).getImm())
186 return MI->getOperand(3).getImm(); 186 return MI->getOperand(3).getImm();
187 187
188 if ((Opcode == PPC::RLWINM || Opcode == PPC::RLWINM_rec || 188 if ((Opcode == PPC::RLWINM || Opcode == PPC::RLWINM_rec ||
189 Opcode == PPC::RLWNM || Opcode == PPC::RLWNM_rec || 189 Opcode == PPC::RLWNM || Opcode == PPC::RLWNM_rec ||
190 Opcode == PPC::RLWINM8 || Opcode == PPC::RLWNM8) && 190 Opcode == PPC::RLWINM8 || Opcode == PPC::RLWNM8) &&
191 MI->getOperand(3).getImm() <= MI->getOperand(4).getImm()) 191 MI->getOperand(3).getImm() <= MI->getOperand(4).getImm())
192 return 32 + MI->getOperand(3).getImm(); 192 return 32 + MI->getOperand(3).getImm();
193 193
194 if (Opcode == PPC::ANDI_rec) { 194 if (Opcode == PPC::ANDI_rec) {
195 uint16_t Imm = MI->getOperand(2).getImm(); 195 uint16_t Imm = MI->getOperand(2).getImm();
196 return 48 + llvm::countl_zero(Imm); 196 return 48 + llvm::countl_zero(Imm);
197 } 197 }
198 198
199 if (Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW || Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW_rec || 199 if (Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW || Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW_rec ||
200 Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW_rec || 200 Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW_rec ||
201 Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW8 || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW8) 201 Opcode == PPC::CNTLZW8 || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZW8)
202 // The result ranges from 0 to 32. 202 // The result ranges from 0 to 32.
203 return 58; 203 return 58;
204 204
205 if (Opcode == PPC::CNTLZD || Opcode == PPC::CNTLZD_rec || 205 if (Opcode == PPC::CNTLZD || Opcode == PPC::CNTLZD_rec ||
206 Opcode == PPC::CNTTZD || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZD_rec) 206 Opcode == PPC::CNTTZD || Opcode == PPC::CNTTZD_rec)
207 // The result ranges from 0 to 64. 207 // The result ranges from 0 to 64.
208 return 57; 208 return 57;
209 209
210 if (Opcode == PPC::LHZ || Opcode == PPC::LHZX || 210 if (Opcode == PPC::LHZ || Opcode == PPC::LHZX ||
211 Opcode == PPC::LHZ8 || Opcode == PPC::LHZX8 || 211 Opcode == PPC::LHZ8 || Opcode == PPC::LHZX8 ||
212 Opcode == PPC::LHZU || Opcode == PPC::LHZUX || 212 Opcode == PPC::LHZU || Opcode == PPC::LHZUX ||
213 Opcode == PPC::LHZU8 || Opcode == PPC::LHZUX8) 213 Opcode == PPC::LHZU8 || Opcode == PPC::LHZUX8)
214 return 48; 214 return 48;
215 215
216 if (Opcode == PPC::LBZ || Opcode == PPC::LBZX || 216 if (Opcode == PPC::LBZ || Opcode == PPC::LBZX ||
217 Opcode == PPC::LBZ8 || Opcode == PPC::LBZX8 || 217 Opcode == PPC::LBZ8 || Opcode == PPC::LBZX8 ||
218 Opcode == PPC::LBZU || Opcode == PPC::LBZUX || 218 Opcode == PPC::LBZU || Opcode == PPC::LBZUX ||
219 Opcode == PPC::LBZU8 || Opcode == PPC::LBZUX8) 219 Opcode == PPC::LBZU8 || Opcode == PPC::LBZUX8)
220 return 56; 220 return 56;
221 221
222 if (Opcode == PPC::AND || Opcode == PPC::AND8 || Opcode == PPC::AND_rec || 222 if (Opcode == PPC::AND || Opcode == PPC::AND8 || Opcode == PPC::AND_rec ||
223 Opcode == PPC::AND8_rec) 223 Opcode == PPC::AND8_rec)
224 return std::max( 224 return std::max(
225 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(1).getReg(), TII, MRI), 225 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(1).getReg(), TII, MRI),
226 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(2).getReg(), TII, MRI)); 226 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(2).getReg(), TII, MRI));
227 227
228 if (Opcode == PPC::OR || Opcode == PPC::OR8 || Opcode == PPC::XOR || 228 if (Opcode == PPC::OR || Opcode == PPC::OR8 || Opcode == PPC::XOR ||
229 Opcode == PPC::XOR8 || Opcode == PPC::OR_rec || 229 Opcode == PPC::XOR8 || Opcode == PPC::OR_rec ||
230 Opcode == PPC::OR8_rec || Opcode == PPC::XOR_rec || 230 Opcode == PPC::OR8_rec || Opcode == PPC::XOR_rec ||
231 Opcode == PPC::XOR8_rec) 231 Opcode == PPC::XOR8_rec)
232 return std::min( 232 return std::min(
233 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(1).getReg(), TII, MRI), 233 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(1).getReg(), TII, MRI),
234 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(2).getReg(), TII, MRI)); 234 getKnownLeadingZeroCount(MI->getOperand(2).getReg(), TII, MRI));
235 235
236 if (TII->isZeroExtended(Reg, MRI)) 236 if (TII->isZeroExtended(Reg, MRI))
237 return 32; 237 return 32;
238 238
239 return 0; 239 return 0;
240 } 240 }

242 // This function maintains a map for the pairs 242 // This function maintains a map for the pairs
243 // Each time a new TOC save is encountered, it checks if any of the existing 243 // Each time a new TOC save is encountered, it checks if any of the existing
244 // ones are dominated by the new one. If so, it marks the existing one as 244 // ones are dominated by the new one. If so, it marks the existing one as
245 // redundant by setting it's entry in the map as false. It then adds the new 245 // redundant by setting it's entry in the map as false. It then adds the new
246 // instruction to the map with either true or false depending on if any 246 // instruction to the map with either true or false depending on if any
247 // existing instructions dominated the new one. 247 // existing instructions dominated the new one.
248 void PPCMIPeephole::UpdateTOCSaves( 248 void PPCMIPeephole::UpdateTOCSaves(
249 std::map &TOCSaves, MachineInstr *MI) { 249 std::map &TOCSaves, MachineInstr *MI) {
250 assert(TII->isTOCSaveMI(*MI) && "Expecting a TOC save instruction here"); 250 assert(TII->isTOCSaveMI(*MI) && "Expecting a TOC save instruction here");
251 // FIXME: Saving TOC in prologue hasn't been implemented well in AIX ABI part, 251 // FIXME: Saving TOC in prologue hasn't been implemented well in AIX ABI part,
252 // here only support it under ELFv2. 252 // here only support it under ELFv2.
253 if (MF->getSubtarget().isELFv2ABI()) { 253 if (MF->getSubtarget().isELFv2ABI()) {
254 PPCFunctionInfo *FI = MF->getInfo(); 254 PPCFunctionInfo *FI = MF->getInfo();
255 255
256 MachineBasicBlock *Entry = &MF->front(); 256 MachineBasicBlock *Entry = &MF->front();
257 uint64_t CurrBlockFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(MI->getParent()).getFrequency(); 257 uint64_t CurrBlockFreq = MBFI->getBlockFreq(MI->getParent()).getFrequency();
258 258
259 // If the block in which the TOC save resides is in a block that 259 // If the block in which the TOC save resides is in a block that
260 // post-dominates Entry, or a block that is hotter than entry (keep in mind 260 // post-dominates Entry, or a block that is hotter than entry (keep in mind
261 // that early MachineLICM has already run so the TOC save won't be hoisted) 261 // that early MachineLICM has already run so the TOC save won't be hoisted)
262 // we can just do the save in the prologue. 262 // we can just do the save in the prologue.
263 if (CurrBlockFreq > EntryFreq || MPDT->dominates(MI->getParent(), Entry)) 263 if (CurrBlockFreq > EntryFreq || MPDT->dominates(MI->getParent(), Entry))
264 FI->setMustSaveTOC(true); 264 FI->setMustSaveTOC(true);
265 265
266 // If we are saving the TOC in the prologue, all the TOC saves can be 266 // If we are saving the TOC in the prologue, all the TOC saves can be
267 // removed from the code. 267 // removed from the code.
268 if (FI->mustSaveTOC()) { 268 if (FI->mustSaveTOC()) {
269 for (auto &TOCSave : TOCSaves) 269 for (auto &TOCSave : TOCSaves)
270 TOCSave.second = false; 270 TOCSave.second = false;
271 // Add new instruction to map. 271 // Add new instruction to map.
272 TOCSaves[MI] = false; 272 TOCSaves[MI] = false;
273 return; 273 return;
274 } 274 }
275 } 275 }
276 276
277 bool Keep = true; 277 bool Keep = true;
278 for (auto &I : TOCSaves) { 278 for (auto &I : TOCSaves) {
279 MachineInstr *CurrInst = I.first; 279 MachineInstr *CurrInst = I.first;
280 // If new instruction dominates an existing one, mark existing one as 280 // If new instruction dominates an existing one, mark existing one as
281 // redundant. 281 // redundant.
282 if (I.second && MDT->dominates(MI, CurrInst)) 282 if (I.second && MDT->dominates(MI, CurrInst))
283 I.second = false; 283 I.second = false;
284 // Check if the new instruction is redundant. 284 // Check if the new instruction is redundant.
285 if (MDT->dominates(CurrInst, MI)) { 285 if (MDT->dominates(CurrInst, MI)) {
286 Keep = false; 286 Keep = false;
287 break; 287 break;
288 } 288 }
289 } 289 }
290 // Add new instruction to map. 290 // Add new instruction to map.
291 TOCSaves[MI] = Keep; 291 TOCSaves[MI] = Keep;
292 } 292 }

294 // This function returns a list of all PHI nodes in the tree starting from 294 // This function returns a list of all PHI nodes in the tree starting from
295 // the RootPHI node. We perform a BFS traversal to get an ordered list of nodes. 295 // the RootPHI node. We perform a BFS traversal to get an ordered list of nodes.
296 // The list initially only contains the root PHI. When we visit a PHI node, we 296 // The list initially only contains the root PHI. When we visit a PHI node, we
297 // add it to the list. We continue to look for other PHI node operands while 297 // add it to the list. We continue to look for other PHI node operands while
298 // there are nodes to visit in the list. The function returns false if the 298 // there are nodes to visit in the list. The function returns false if the
299 // optimization cannot be applied on this tree. 299 // optimization cannot be applied on this tree.
300 static bool collectUnprimedAccPHIs(MachineRegisterInfo *MRI, 300 static bool collectUnprimedAccPHIs(MachineRegisterInfo *MRI,
301 MachineInstr *RootPHI, 301 MachineInstr *RootPHI,
302 SmallVectorImpl &PHIs) { 302 SmallVectorImpl &PHIs) {
303 PHIs.push_back(RootPHI); 303 PHIs.push_back(RootPHI);

305 while (VisitedIndex < PHIs.size()) { 305 while (VisitedIndex < PHIs.size()) {
306 MachineInstr *VisitedPHI = PHIs[VisitedIndex]; 306 MachineInstr *VisitedPHI = PHIs[VisitedIndex];

309 Register RegOp = VisitedPHI->getOperand(PHIOp).getReg(); 309 Register RegOp = VisitedPHI->getOperand(PHIOp).getReg();
310 if (!RegOp.isVirtual()) 310 if (!RegOp.isVirtual())
311 return false; 311 return false;
312 MachineInstr *Instr = MRI->getVRegDef(RegOp); 312 MachineInstr *Instr = MRI->getVRegDef(RegOp);
313 // While collecting the PHI nodes, we check if they can be converted (i.e. 313 // While collecting the PHI nodes, we check if they can be converted (i.e.
314 // all the operands are either copies, implicit defs or PHI nodes). 314 // all the operands are either copies, implicit defs or PHI nodes).

322 // If we detect a cycle in the PHI nodes, we exit. It would be 322 // If we detect a cycle in the PHI nodes, we exit. It would be
323 // possible to change cycles as well, but that would add a lot 323 // possible to change cycles as well, but that would add a lot

325 // code. 325 // code.

327 continue; 327 continue;

329 return false; 329 return false;

331 } 331 }

337 // This function changes the unprimed accumulator PHI nodes in the PHIs list to 337 // This function changes the unprimed accumulator PHI nodes in the PHIs list to
338 // primed accumulator PHI nodes. The list is traversed in reverse order to 338 // primed accumulator PHI nodes. The list is traversed in reverse order to
339 // change all the PHI operands of a PHI node before changing the node itself. 339 // change all the PHI operands of a PHI node before changing the node itself.
340 // We keep a map to associate each changed PHI node to its non-changed form. 340 // We keep a map to associate each changed PHI node to its non-changed form.
341 static void convertUnprimedAccPHIs(const PPCInstrInfo *TII, 341 static void convertUnprimedAccPHIs(const PPCInstrInfo *TII,
342 MachineRegisterInfo *MRI, 342 MachineRegisterInfo *MRI,
343 SmallVectorImpl &PHIs, 343 SmallVectorImpl &PHIs,
344 Register Dst) { 344 Register Dst) {
345 DenseMap ChangedPHIMap; 345 DenseMap ChangedPHIMap;
346 for (MachineInstr *PHI : llvm::reverse(PHIs)) { 346 for (MachineInstr *PHI : llvm::reverse(PHIs)) {
347 SmallVector, 4> PHIOps; 347 SmallVector, 4> PHIOps;
348 // We check if the current PHI node can be changed by looking at its 348 // We check if the current PHI node can be changed by looking at its
349 // operands. If all the operands are either copies from primed 349 // operands. If all the operands are either copies from primed
350 // accumulators, implicit definitions or other unprimed accumulator 350 // accumulators, implicit definitions or other unprimed accumulator
351 // PHI nodes, we change it. 351 // PHI nodes, we change it.
352 for (unsigned PHIOp = 1, NumOps = PHI->getNumOperands(); PHIOp != NumOps; 352 for (unsigned PHIOp = 1, NumOps = PHI->getNumOperands(); PHIOp != NumOps;
353 PHIOp += 2) { 353 PHIOp += 2) {
354 Register RegOp = PHI->getOperand(PHIOp).getReg(); 354 Register RegOp = PHI->getOperand(PHIOp).getReg();
355 MachineInstr *PHIInput = MRI->getVRegDef(RegOp); 355 MachineInstr *PHIInput = MRI->getVRegDef(RegOp);
356 unsigned Opcode = PHIInput->getOpcode(); 356 unsigned Opcode = PHIInput->getOpcode();
357 assert((Opcode == PPC::COPY || Opcode == PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF || 357 assert((Opcode == PPC::COPY || Opcode == PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF ||
358 Opcode == PPC::PHI) && 358 Opcode == PPC::PHI) &&
359 "Unexpected instruction"); 359 "Unexpected instruction");
360 if (Opcode == PPC::COPY) { 360 if (Opcode == PPC::COPY) {
361 assert(MRI->getRegClass(PHIInput->getOperand(1).getReg()) == 361 assert(MRI->getRegClass(PHIInput->getOperand(1).getReg()) ==
362 &PPC::ACCRCRegClass && 362 &PPC::ACCRCRegClass &&
363 "Unexpected register class"); 363 "Unexpected register class");
364 PHIOps.push_back({PHIInput->getOperand(1), PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)}); 364 PHIOps.push_back({PHIInput->getOperand(1), PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)});
365 } else if (Opcode == PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF) { 365 } else if (Opcode == PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF) {
366 Register AccReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::ACCRCRegClass); 366 Register AccReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::ACCRCRegClass);
367 BuildMI(*PHIInput->getParent(), PHIInput, PHIInput->getDebugLoc(), 367 BuildMI(*PHIInput->getParent(), PHIInput, PHIInput->getDebugLoc(),
368 TII->get(PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF), AccReg); 368 TII->get(PPC::IMPLICIT_DEF), AccReg);
369 PHIOps.push_back({MachineOperand::CreateReg(AccReg, false), 369 PHIOps.push_back({MachineOperand::CreateReg(AccReg, false),
370 PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)}); 370 PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)});
371 } else if (Opcode == PPC::PHI) { 371 } else if (Opcode == PPC::PHI) {
372 // We found a PHI operand. At this point we know this operand 372 // We found a PHI operand. At this point we know this operand
373 // has already been changed so we get its associated changed form 373 // has already been changed so we get its associated changed form
374 // from the map. 374 // from the map.
375 assert(ChangedPHIMap.count(PHIInput) == 1 && 375 assert(ChangedPHIMap.count(PHIInput) == 1 &&
376 "This PHI node should have already been changed."); 376 "This PHI node should have already been changed.");
377 MachineInstr *PrimedAccPHI = ChangedPHIMap.lookup(PHIInput); 377 MachineInstr *PrimedAccPHI = ChangedPHIMap.lookup(PHIInput);
378 PHIOps.push_back({MachineOperand::CreateReg( 378 PHIOps.push_back({MachineOperand::CreateReg(
379 PrimedAccPHI->getOperand(0).getReg(), false), 379 PrimedAccPHI->getOperand(0).getReg(), false),
380 PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)}); 380 PHI->getOperand(PHIOp + 1)});
381 } 381 }
382 } 382 }
383 Register AccReg = Dst; 383 Register AccReg = Dst;
384 // If the PHI node we are changing is the root node, the register it defines 384 // If the PHI node we are changing is the root node, the register it defines
385 // will be the destination register of the original copy (of the PHI def). 385 // will be the destination register of the original copy (of the PHI def).
386 // For all other PHI's in the list, we need to create another primed 386 // For all other PHI's in the list, we need to create another primed
387 // accumulator virtual register as the PHI will no longer define the 387 // accumulator virtual register as the PHI will no longer define the
388 // unprimed accumulator. 388 // unprimed accumulator.
389 if (PHI != PHIs[0]) 389 if (PHI != PHIs[0])
390 AccReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::ACCRCRegClass); 390 AccReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::ACCRCRegClass);
391 MachineInstrBuilder NewPHI = BuildMI( 391 MachineInstrBuilder NewPHI = BuildMI(

393 for (auto RegMBB : PHIOps) 393 for (auto RegMBB : PHIOps)
394 NewPHI.add(RegMBB.first).add(RegMBB.second); 394 NewPHI.add(RegMBB.first).add(RegMBB.second);
395 ChangedPHIMap[PHI] = NewPHI.getInstr(); 395 ChangedPHIMap[PHI] = NewPHI.getInstr();
396 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converting PHI: "); 396 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converting PHI: ");

403 // Perform peephole optimizations. 403 // Perform peephole optimizations.
404 bool PPCMIPeephole::simplifyCode() { 404 bool PPCMIPeephole::simplifyCode() {
405 bool Simplified = false; 405 bool Simplified = false;
406 bool TrapOpt = false; 406 bool TrapOpt = false;
407 MachineInstr* ToErase = nullptr; 407 MachineInstr* ToErase = nullptr;
408 std::map TOCSaves; 408 std::map TOCSaves;
409 const TargetRegisterInfo *TRI = &TII->getRegisterInfo(); 409 const TargetRegisterInfo *TRI = &TII->getRegisterInfo();
410 NumFunctionsEnteredInMIPeephole++; 410 NumFunctionsEnteredInMIPeephole++;
411 if (ConvertRegReg) { 411 if (ConvertRegReg) {
412 // Fixed-point conversion of reg/reg instructions fed by load-immediate 412 // Fixed-point conversion of reg/reg instructions fed by load-immediate
413 // into reg/imm instructions. FIXME: This is expensive, control it with 413 // into reg/imm instructions. FIXME: This is expensive, control it with
414 // an option. 414 // an option.
415 bool SomethingChanged = false; 415 bool SomethingChanged = false;
416 do { 416 do {
417 NumFixedPointIterations++; 417 NumFixedPointIterations++;
418 SomethingChanged = false; 418 SomethingChanged = false;
419 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *MF) { 419 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *MF) {
420 for (MachineInstr &MI : MBB) { 420 for (MachineInstr &MI : MBB) {
421 if (MI.isDebugInstr()) 421 if (MI.isDebugInstr())
422 continue; 422 continue;
423 423
424 if (TII->convertToImmediateForm(MI)) { 424 if (TII->convertToImmediateForm(MI)) {
425 // We don't erase anything in case the def has other uses. Let DCE 425 // We don't erase anything in case the def has other uses. Let DCE
426 // remove it if it can be removed. 426 // remove it if it can be removed.
427 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converted instruction to imm form: "); 427 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converted instruction to imm form: ");
428 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 428 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump());
429 NumConvertedToImmediateForm++; 429 NumConvertedToImmediateForm++;
430 SomethingChanged = true; 430 SomethingChanged = true;
431 Simplified = true; 431 Simplified = true;
432 continue; 432 continue;
433 } 433 }
434 } 434 }
435 } 435 }
436 } while (SomethingChanged && FixedPointRegToImm); 436 } while (SomethingChanged && FixedPointRegToImm);
437 } 437 }
438 438
439 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *MF) { 439 for (MachineBasicBlock &MBB : *MF) {
440 for (MachineInstr &MI : MBB) { 440 for (MachineInstr &MI : MBB) {

1004 1004
1005 auto dominatesAllSingleUseLIs = [&](MachineOperand *DominatorOp, 1005 auto dominatesAllSingleUseLIs = [&](MachineOperand *DominatorOp,
1006 MachineOperand *PhiOp) { 1006 MachineOperand *PhiOp) {
1007 assert(PhiOp && "Invalid Operand!"); 1007 assert(PhiOp && "Invalid Operand!");
1008 assert(DominatorOp && "Invalid Operand!"); 1008 assert(DominatorOp && "Invalid Operand!");
1009 MachineInstr *DefPhiMI = getVRegDefOrNull(PhiOp, MRI); 1009 MachineInstr *DefPhiMI = getVRegDefOrNull(PhiOp, MRI);
1010 MachineInstr *DefDomMI = getVRegDefOrNull(DominatorOp, MRI); 1010 MachineInstr *DefDomMI = getVRegDefOrNull(DominatorOp, MRI);
1011 1011
1012 // Note: the vregs only show up at odd indices position of PHI Node, 1012 // Note: the vregs only show up at odd indices position of PHI Node,
1013 // the even indices position save the BB info. 1013 // the even indices position save the BB info.
1014 for (unsigned i = 1; i < DefPhiMI->getNumOperands(); i += 2) { 1014 for (unsigned i = 1; i < DefPhiMI->getNumOperands(); i += 2) {
1015 MachineInstr *LiMI = 1015 MachineInstr *LiMI =

1019 || !MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(LiMI->getOperand(0).getReg()) || 1019 || !MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(LiMI->getOperand(0).getReg()) ||
1020 !MDT->dominates(DefDomMI, LiMI)) 1020 !MDT->dominates(DefDomMI, LiMI))
1021 return false; 1021 return false;
1022 } 1022 }
1023 1023
1024 return true; 1024 return true;
1025 }; 1025 };

1027 MachineOperand Op1 = MI.getOperand(1); 1027 MachineOperand Op1 = MI.getOperand(1);
1028 MachineOperand Op2 = MI.getOperand(2); 1028 MachineOperand Op2 = MI.getOperand(2);
1029 if (isSingleUsePHI(&Op2) && dominatesAllSingleUseLIs(&Op1, &Op2)) 1029 if (isSingleUsePHI(&Op2) && dominatesAllSingleUseLIs(&Op1, &Op2))
1030 std::swap(Op1, Op2); 1030 std::swap(Op1, Op2);
1031 else if (!isSingleUsePHI(&Op1) || !dominatesAllSingleUseLIs(&Op2, &Op1)) 1031 else if (!isSingleUsePHI(&Op1) || !dominatesAllSingleUseLIs(&Op2, &Op1))
1032 break; // We don't have an ADD fed by LI's that can be transformed 1032 break; // We don't have an ADD fed by LI's that can be transformed

1274 auto isEligibleBB = [&](MachineBasicBlock &BB) { 1274 auto isEligibleBB = [&](MachineBasicBlock &BB) {
1275 auto BII = BB.getFirstInstrTerminator(); 1275 auto BII = BB.getFirstInstrTerminator();

1278 // will be formed only later in the pipeline. 1278 // will be formed only later in the pipeline.

1280 BII != BB.instr_end() && 1280 BII != BB.instr_end() &&
1281 (*BII).getOpcode() == PPC::BCC && 1281 (*BII).getOpcode() == PPC::BCC &&

1291 return false; 1291 return false;

1299 } 1299 }
1300 return false; 1300 return false;
1301 }; 1301 };

1303 // If this BB has more than one successor, we can create a new BB and 1303 // If this BB has more than one successor, we can create a new BB and

1305 // So far, we do not move compare instruction to a BB having multiple 1305 // So far, we do not move compare instruction to a BB having multiple

1307 auto isEligibleForMoveCmp = [](MachineBasicBlock &BB) { 1307 auto isEligibleForMoveCmp = [](MachineBasicBlock &BB) {

1323 else if (NumPredBBs == 2) { 1323 else if (NumPredBBs == 2) {
1324 // We check for partially redundant case. 1324 // We check for partially redundant case.
1325 // So far, we support cases with only two predecessors 1325 // So far, we support cases with only two predecessors
1326 // to avoid increasing the number of instructions. 1326 // to avoid increasing the number of instructions.

1391 // conditional branches on this comparison. 1391 // conditional branches on this comparison.
1392 // For example, 1392 // For example,

1621 1621
1622 assert(Inst->getOpcode() == PPC::PHI && 1622 assert(Inst->getOpcode() == PPC::PHI &&
1623 "We cannot support if an operand comes from this BB."); 1623 "We cannot support if an operand comes from this BB.");
1624 unsigned SrcReg = getIncomingRegForBlock(Inst, MBBtoMoveCmp); 1624 unsigned SrcReg = getIncomingRegForBlock(Inst, MBBtoMoveCmp);
1625 CMPI2->getOperand(I).setReg(SrcReg); 1625 CMPI2->getOperand(I).setReg(SrcReg);
1626 } 1626 }
1627 } 1627 }
1628 auto I = MachineBasicBlock::iterator(MBBtoMoveCmp->getFirstTerminator()); 1628 auto I = MachineBasicBlock::iterator(MBBtoMoveCmp->getFirstTerminator());
1629 MBBtoMoveCmp->splice(I, &MBB2, MachineBasicBlock::iterator(CMPI2)); 1629 MBBtoMoveCmp->splice(I, &MBB2, MachineBasicBlock::iterator(CMPI2));
1630 1630
1631 DebugLoc DL = CMPI2->getDebugLoc(); 1631 DebugLoc DL = CMPI2->getDebugLoc();
1632 Register NewVReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::CRRCRegClass); 1632 Register NewVReg = MRI->createVirtualRegister(&PPC::CRRCRegClass);
1633 BuildMI(MBB2, MBB2.begin(), DL, 1633 BuildMI(MBB2, MBB2.begin(), DL,
1634 TII->get(PPC::PHI), NewVReg) 1634 TII->get(PPC::PHI), NewVReg)
1635 .addReg(BI1->getOperand(1).getReg()).addMBB(MBB1) 1635 .addReg(BI1->getOperand(1).getReg()).addMBB(MBB1)
1636 .addReg(BI2->getOperand(1).getReg()).addMBB(MBBtoMoveCmp); 1636 .addReg(BI2->getOperand(1).getReg()).addMBB(MBBtoMoveCmp);
1637 BI2->getOperand(1).setReg(NewVReg); 1637 BI2->getOperand(1).setReg(NewVReg);
1638 } 1638 }
1639 else { 1639 else {
1640 // We finally eliminate compare instruction in MBB2. 1640 // We finally eliminate compare instruction in MBB2.
1641 BI2->getOperand(1).setReg(BI1->getOperand(1).getReg()); 1641 BI2->getOperand(1).setReg(BI1->getOperand(1).getReg());
1642 CMPI2->eraseFromParent(); 1642 CMPI2->eraseFromParent();
1643 } 1643 }
1644 BI2->getOperand(1).setIsKill(true); 1644 BI2->getOperand(1).setIsKill(true);
1645 BI1->getOperand(1).setIsKill(false); 1645 BI1->getOperand(1).setIsKill(false);
1646 1646
1647 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "into a compare and two branches:\n"); 1647 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "into a compare and two branches:\n");
1648 LLVM_DEBUG(CMPI1->dump()); 1648 LLVM_DEBUG(CMPI1->dump());
1649 LLVM_DEBUG(BI1->dump()); 1649 LLVM_DEBUG(BI1->dump());
1650 LLVM_DEBUG(BI2->dump()); 1650 LLVM_DEBUG(BI2->dump());
1651 if (IsPartiallyRedundant) { 1651 if (IsPartiallyRedundant) {
1652 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "The following compare is moved into " 1652 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "The following compare is moved into "
1653 << printMBBReference(*MBBtoMoveCmp) 1653 << printMBBReference(*MBBtoMoveCmp)
1654 << " to handle partial redundancy.\n"); 1654 << " to handle partial redundancy.\n");
1655 LLVM_DEBUG(CMPI2->dump()); 1655 LLVM_DEBUG(CMPI2->dump());
1656 } 1656 }
1657 1657
1658 Simplified = true; 1658 Simplified = true;
1659 } 1659 }
1660 1660
1661 return Simplified; 1661 return Simplified;
1662 } 1662 }
1663 1663
1664 // We miss the opportunity to emit an RLDIC when lowering jump tables 1664 // We miss the opportunity to emit an RLDIC when lowering jump tables
1665 // since ISEL sees only a single basic block. When selecting, the clear 1665 // since ISEL sees only a single basic block. When selecting, the clear
1666 // and shift left will be in different blocks. 1666 // and shift left will be in different blocks.
1667 bool PPCMIPeephole::emitRLDICWhenLoweringJumpTables(MachineInstr &MI) { 1667 bool PPCMIPeephole::emitRLDICWhenLoweringJumpTables(MachineInstr &MI) {
1668 if (MI.getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICR) 1668 if (MI.getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICR)
1669 return false; 1669 return false;
1670 1670
1671 Register SrcReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg(); 1671 Register SrcReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg();
1672 if (!SrcReg.isVirtual()) 1672 if (!SrcReg.isVirtual())
1673 return false; 1673 return false;
1674 1674
1675 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcReg); 1675 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcReg);
1676 if (SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICL) 1676 if (SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICL)
1677 return false; 1677 return false;
1678 1678
1679 MachineOperand MOpSHSrc = SrcMI->getOperand(2); 1679 MachineOperand MOpSHSrc = SrcMI->getOperand(2);
1680 MachineOperand MOpMBSrc = SrcMI->getOperand(3); 1680 MachineOperand MOpMBSrc = SrcMI->getOperand(3);
1681 MachineOperand MOpSHMI = MI.getOperand(2); 1681 MachineOperand MOpSHMI = MI.getOperand(2);
1682 MachineOperand MOpMEMI = MI.getOperand(3); 1682 MachineOperand MOpMEMI = MI.getOperand(3);
1683 if (!(MOpSHSrc.isImm() && MOpMBSrc.isImm() && MOpSHMI.isImm() && 1683 if (!(MOpSHSrc.isImm() && MOpMBSrc.isImm() && MOpSHMI.isImm() &&
1684 MOpMEMI.isImm())) 1684 MOpMEMI.isImm()))
1685 return false; 1685 return false;
1686 1686
1687 uint64_t SHSrc = MOpSHSrc.getImm(); 1687 uint64_t SHSrc = MOpSHSrc.getImm();
1688 uint64_t MBSrc = MOpMBSrc.getImm(); 1688 uint64_t MBSrc = MOpMBSrc.getImm();
1689 uint64_t SHMI = MOpSHMI.getImm(); 1689 uint64_t SHMI = MOpSHMI.getImm();
1690 uint64_t MEMI = MOpMEMI.getImm(); 1690 uint64_t MEMI = MOpMEMI.getImm();
1691 uint64_t NewSH = SHSrc + SHMI; 1691 uint64_t NewSH = SHSrc + SHMI;
1692 uint64_t NewMB = MBSrc - SHMI; 1692 uint64_t NewMB = MBSrc - SHMI;
1693 if (NewMB > 63 || NewSH > 63) 1693 if (NewMB > 63 || NewSH > 63)
1694 return false; 1694 return false;
1695 1695
1696 // The bits cleared with RLDICL are [0, MBSrc). 1696 // The bits cleared with RLDICL are [0, MBSrc).
1697 // The bits cleared with RLDICR are (MEMI, 63]. 1697 // The bits cleared with RLDICR are (MEMI, 63].
1698 // After the sequence, the bits cleared are: 1698 // After the sequence, the bits cleared are:
1699 // [0, MBSrc-SHMI) and (MEMI, 63). 1699 // [0, MBSrc-SHMI) and (MEMI, 63).
1700 // 1700 //
1701 // The bits cleared with RLDIC are [0, NewMB) and (63-NewSH, 63]. 1701 // The bits cleared with RLDIC are [0, NewMB) and (63-NewSH, 63].
1702 if ((63 - NewSH) != MEMI) 1702 if ((63 - NewSH) != MEMI)
1703 return false; 1703 return false;
1704 1704
1705 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converting pair: "); 1705 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Converting pair: ");
1706 LLVM_DEBUG(SrcMI->dump()); 1706 LLVM_DEBUG(SrcMI->dump());
1707 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 1707 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump());
1708 1708
1709 MI.setDesc(TII->get(PPC::RLDIC)); 1709 MI.setDesc(TII->get(PPC::RLDIC));
1710 MI.getOperand(1).setReg(SrcMI->getOperand(1).getReg()); 1710 MI.getOperand(1).setReg(SrcMI->getOperand(1).getReg());
1711 MI.getOperand(2).setImm(NewSH); 1711 MI.getOperand(2).setImm(NewSH);
1712 MI.getOperand(3).setImm(NewMB); 1712 MI.getOperand(3).setImm(NewMB);
1713 MI.getOperand(1).setIsKill(SrcMI->getOperand(1).isKill()); 1713 MI.getOperand(1).setIsKill(SrcMI->getOperand(1).isKill());
1714 SrcMI->getOperand(1).setIsKill(false); 1714 SrcMI->getOperand(1).setIsKill(false);
1715 1715
1716 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "To: "); 1716 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "To: ");
1717 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 1717 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump());
1718 NumRotatesCollapsed++; 1718 NumRotatesCollapsed++;
1719 // If SrcReg has no non-debug use it's safe to delete its def SrcMI. 1719 // If SrcReg has no non-debug use it's safe to delete its def SrcMI.
1720 if (MRI->use_nodbg_empty(SrcReg)) { 1720 if (MRI->use_nodbg_empty(SrcReg)) {
1721 assert(!SrcMI->hasImplicitDef() && 1721 assert(!SrcMI->hasImplicitDef() &&
1722 "Not expecting an implicit def with this instr."); 1722 "Not expecting an implicit def with this instr.");
1723 SrcMI->eraseFromParent(); 1723 SrcMI->eraseFromParent();
1724 } 1724 }
1725 return true; 1725 return true;
1726 } 1726 }
1727 1727
1728 // For case in LLVM IR 1728 // For case in LLVM IR
1729 // entry: 1729 // entry:
1730 // %iconv = sext i32 %index to i64 1730 // %iconv = sext i32 %index to i64
1731 // br i1 undef label %true, label %false 1731 // br i1 undef label %true, label %false
1732 // true: 1732 // true:
1733 // %ptr = getelementptr inbounds i32, i32* null, i64 %iconv 1733 // %ptr = getelementptr inbounds i32, i32* null, i64 %iconv
1734 // ... 1734 // ...
1735 // PPCISelLowering::combineSHL fails to combine, because sext and shl are in 1735 // PPCISelLowering::combineSHL fails to combine, because sext and shl are in
1736 // different BBs when conducting instruction selection. We can do a peephole 1736 // different BBs when conducting instruction selection. We can do a peephole
1737 // optimization to combine these two instructions into extswsli after 1737 // optimization to combine these two instructions into extswsli after
1738 // instruction selection. 1738 // instruction selection.
1739 bool PPCMIPeephole::combineSEXTAndSHL(MachineInstr &MI, 1739 bool PPCMIPeephole::combineSEXTAndSHL(MachineInstr &MI,
1740 MachineInstr *&ToErase) { 1740 MachineInstr *&ToErase) {
1741 if (MI.getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICR) 1741 if (MI.getOpcode() != PPC::RLDICR)
1742 return false; 1742 return false;
1743 1743
1744 if (!MF->getSubtarget().isISA3_0()) 1744 if (!MF->getSubtarget().isISA3_0())
1745 return false; 1745 return false;
1746 1746
1747 assert(MI.getNumOperands() == 4 && "RLDICR should have 4 operands"); 1747 assert(MI.getNumOperands() == 4 && "RLDICR should have 4 operands");
1748 1748
1749 MachineOperand MOpSHMI = MI.getOperand(2); 1749 MachineOperand MOpSHMI = MI.getOperand(2);
1750 MachineOperand MOpMEMI = MI.getOperand(3); 1750 MachineOperand MOpMEMI = MI.getOperand(3);
1751 if (!(MOpSHMI.isImm() && MOpMEMI.isImm())) 1751 if (!(MOpSHMI.isImm() && MOpMEMI.isImm()))
1752 return false; 1752 return false;
1753 1753
1754 uint64_t SHMI = MOpSHMI.getImm(); 1754 uint64_t SHMI = MOpSHMI.getImm();
1755 uint64_t MEMI = MOpMEMI.getImm(); 1755 uint64_t MEMI = MOpMEMI.getImm();
1756 if (SHMI + MEMI != 63) 1756 if (SHMI + MEMI != 63)
1757 return false; 1757 return false;
1758 1758
1759 Register SrcReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg(); 1759 Register SrcReg = MI.getOperand(1).getReg();
1760 if (!SrcReg.isVirtual()) 1760 if (!SrcReg.isVirtual())
1761 return false; 1761 return false;
1762 1762
1763 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcReg); 1763 MachineInstr *SrcMI = MRI->getVRegDef(SrcReg);
1764 if (SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::EXTSW && 1764 if (SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::EXTSW &&
1765 SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::EXTSW_32_64) 1765 SrcMI->getOpcode() != PPC::EXTSW_32_64)
1766 return false; 1766 return false;
1767 1767
1768 // If the register defined by extsw has more than one use, combination is not 1768 // If the register defined by extsw has more than one use, combination is not
1769 // needed. 1769 // needed.
1770 if (!MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(SrcReg)) 1770 if (!MRI->hasOneNonDBGUse(SrcReg))
1771 return false; 1771 return false;
1772 1772
1773 assert(SrcMI->getNumOperands() == 2 && "EXTSW should have 2 operands"); 1773 assert(SrcMI->getNumOperands() == 2 && "EXTSW should have 2 operands");
1774 assert(SrcMI->getOperand(1).isReg() && 1774 assert(SrcMI->getOperand(1).isReg() &&
1775 "EXTSW's second operand should be a register"); 1775 "EXTSW's second operand should be a register");
1776 if (!SrcMI->getOperand(1).getReg().isVirtual()) 1776 if (!SrcMI->getOperand(1).getReg().isVirtual())
1777 return false; 1777 return false;
1778 1778
1779 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Combining pair: "); 1779 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "Combining pair: ");
1780 LLVM_DEBUG(SrcMI->dump()); 1780 LLVM_DEBUG(SrcMI->dump());
1781 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump()); 1781 LLVM_DEBUG(MI.dump());
1782 1782
1783 MachineInstr *NewInstr = 1783 MachineInstr *NewInstr =
1784 BuildMI(*MI.getParent(), &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), 1784 BuildMI(*MI.getParent(), &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(),
1785 SrcMI->getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSW ? TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI) 1785 SrcMI->getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSW ? TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI)
1786 : TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI_32_64), 1786 : TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI_32_64),
1787 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 1787 MI.getOperand(0).getReg())
1788 .add(SrcMI->getOperand(1)) 1788 .add(SrcMI->getOperand(1))
1789 .add(MOpSHMI); 1789 .add(MOpSHMI);
1790 (void)NewInstr; 1790 (void)NewInstr;
1791 1791
1792 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "TO: "); 1792 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "TO: ");
1793 LLVM_DEBUG(NewInstr->dump()); 1793 LLVM_DEBUG(NewInstr->dump());
1794 ++NumEXTSWAndSLDICombined; 1794 ++NumEXTSWAndSLDICombined;
1795 ToErase = &MI; 1795 ToErase = &MI;
1796 // SrcMI, which is extsw, is of no use now, erase it. 1796 // SrcMI, which is extsw, is of no use now, erase it.
1797 SrcMI->eraseFromParent(); 1797 SrcMI->eraseFromParent();
1798 return true; 1798 return true;
1799 } 1799 }
1800 1800
1801 } // end default namespace 1801 } // end default namespace

8 // --- 8 // ---
9 // This pass performs peephole optimizations to clean up ugly code --- 9 // This pass performs peephole optimizations to clean up ugly code ---
10 // sequences at the MachineInstruction layer. It runs at the end of --- 10 // sequences at the MachineInstruction layer. It runs at the end of ---
11 // the SSA phases, following VSX swap removal. A pass of dead code --- 11 // the SSA phases, following VSX swap removal. A pass of dead code ---
12 // elimination follows this one for quick clean-up of any dead --- 12 // elimination follows this one for quick clean-up of any dead ---
13 // instructions introduced here. Although we could do this as callbacks --- 13 // instructions introduced here. Although we could do this as callbacks ---
14 // from the generic peephole pass, this would have a couple of bad --- 14 // from the generic peephole pass, this would have a couple of bad ---
15 // effects: it might remove optimization opportunities for VSX swap --- 15 // effects: it might remove optimization opportunities for VSX swap ---
16 // removal, and it would miss cleanups made possible following VSX --- 16 // removal, and it would miss cleanups made possible following VSX ---
17 // swap removal. --- 17 // swap removal. ---

294 // This function returns a list of all PHI nodes in the tree starting from --- 294 // This function returns a list of all PHI nodes in the tree starting from ---

1196 // We can decrement immediate x in (GE x) by changing it to (GT x-1) or --- 1196 // We can decrement immediate x in (GE x) by changing it to (GT x-1) or ---

1213 } --- 1213 } ---

1401 // cmplwi r3, 0 --- 1401 // cmplwi r3, 0 ---
1402 // beq 0, .LBB0_3 --- 1402 // beq 0, .LBB0_3 ---

1782 --- 1782 ---
1783 MachineInstr *NewInstr = --- 1783 MachineInstr *NewInstr = ---
1784 BuildMI(*MI.getParent(), &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), 0 1784 BuildMI(*MI.getParent(), &MI, MI.getDebugLoc(), 0
1785 SrcMI->getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSW ? TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI) 0 1785 SrcMI->getOpcode() == PPC::EXTSW ? TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI) 0
1786 : TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI_32_64), 0 1786 : TII->get(PPC::EXTSWSLI_32_64), 0
1787 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0 1787 MI.getOperand(0).getReg()) 0
1788 .add(SrcMI->getOperand(1)) 0 1788 .add(SrcMI->getOperand(1)) 0
1789 .add(MOpSHMI); 0 1789 .add(MOpSHMI); 0
1790 (void)NewInstr; --- 1790 (void)NewInstr; ---
1791 --- 1791 ---
1792 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "TO: "); 0 1792 LLVM_DEBUG(dbgs() << "TO: "); 0
1793 LLVM_DEBUG(NewInstr->dump()); 0 1793 LLVM_DEBUG(NewInstr->dump()); 0
1794 ++NumEXTSWAndSLDICombined; 0 1794 ++NumEXTSWAndSLDICombined; 0
1795 ToErase = &MI; 0 1795 ToErase = &MI; 0
1796 // SrcMI, which is extsw, is of no use now, erase it. --- 1796 // SrcMI, which is extsw, is of no use now, erase it. ---
1797 SrcMI->eraseFromParent(); 0 1797 SrcMI->eraseFromParent(); 0
1798 return true; 0 1798 return true; 0
1799 } --- 1799 } ---
1800 --- 1800 ---
1801 } // end default namespace --- 1801 } // end default namespace ---
1802 --- 1802 ---
1803 INITIALIZE_PASS_BEGIN(PPCMIPeephole, DEBUG_TYPE, 1 1803 INITIALIZE_PASS_BEGIN(PPCMIPeephole, DEBUG_TYPE, 1
1804 "PowerPC MI Peephole Optimization", false, false) --- 1804 "PowerPC MI Peephole Optimization", false, false) ---
